description:
This is one of my favorite places so I wanted it to be my first yelp review! 

When I'm in town, this is my first stop! 

Excellent service and authentic food.
author: Patty G.

description:
This is the first experience in this restaurant.
I ask the sushi chef the recommendation cuz I don't know what to order
There is Otoro just arrive today and the chef just cut me some piece and let me try 
It is the best and freshest Otoro I had around downtown area and the price is good, very worth for this quality of food.
Very happy about what I had this lunch. 5 star for sure
author: Carl H.

description:
Ok place, believe under new ownership. You eat in San Francisco you pay San Francisco prices. I use to go often but the prices almost doubled. Lunch use to cost on average $8.00, now $14.00. I get it cost of rent and health care for employees, prices need to go up. Good friendly service.
Food is good portions size but sushi rolls have gotten smaller. But looks and taste fresh so that's a big . Tempura Udon is my favorite, beautiful bowl of warm goodness. 
Bang for ur buck? kinda sorta. Nice place to get ur Japanese craving cured, but prepare to pay the Samurai.
author: M I.

description:
I went yesterday just for the nigiri sushi and it was EXCELLENT. The toro nigiri for two pieces was only $6.95 which is unheard of and the portion and quality is much better than any toro who charge more than double at high end sushi places!!!!

Just be careful not to order WHITE TUNA WHICH IS ESCOLAR OR BUTTERFISH. It gives you diarrhea because of their heavy oils which is undigestible.
author: N A.

description:
I like Zaoh because for the most part the fish is very fresh and they are generous with their fish portions. I am not a fan of the "everything-and-the-kitchen-sink" rolls, where it is impossible to tell how fresh the fish is. I like the taste of raw fish. I like large pieces of beautifully cut, super fresh sashimi and Zaoh does this well.

As far as I can tell Zaoh pretty much gets its fish daily. Their portion used to be larger. They scaled back a little about 6 months ago, but they are still good value.

I eat a small amount of sushi pretty much every day.  I'll even occasionally eat sushi for breakfast. If fish oil is good for you I figure I might as well get it from the source. At my age, mercury poisoning's impact on young brain development from eating too much fish is the least of my worries.

Zaoh is one of my favorites because of consistent quality.  A solid 4 stars for me.
author: David T.

description: Good place to hangout with my girl today Chinese Valentine's Day. Everything is good here.
author: 兆生

description:
I was really craving some Pho while I was vising San Francisco but at lunch time downtown I just wandered around before finding Zaoh on Yelp. I'm glad I did, they bring out hot green tea when you arrive, which was plain but good as well as what I think were sauteed bean sprouts. They were odd and warm but I'm really not sure what exactly they were. The service was fast and friendly. 

I ordered the beef soup with odon noodles, which was flavorful but could have used some spice (sriracha.) I realize not a lot of authentic places bother carrying it, and I didn't even ask. Honestly, I wish I would've ordered the sushi. But it did satisfy my soup craving, so I left happy.
author: Allie W.

description:
I can't speak to dining in at Zaoh, but I'm writing this review with a full stomach after dining on delivery from Zaoh.

It wasn't incredible, and I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to order again, but it wasn't bad either.  Delivery was quick, prices moderate, and order was accurate upon arrival... chopsticks, soy sauce, wasabi, and ginger included!

I had a seaweed salad, futomaki roll, california roll, and salmon skin hand roll.  I was so hungry I dove in before taking any pictures but presentation was solid, especially for delivery.  

If you find yourself in a hotel within delivery range and craving some basic sushi, you can't go wrong with Zaoh!
author: Gabi M.

description:
Decent cuts of sashimi, not the freshest I've seen but it gets the job done.  Don't order the Agedashi Tofu, it is not authentic. They don't use Silken Tofu.  The chicken Katsu is a bit flat for my liking. 

Again, solid place for rolls and if you're looking for something to meet your Japanese cravings. Service is friendly, although the place is a bit outdated.  Prices are inexpensive for the area.
author: Kay H.

description: I regret not walking there to get my $14 back for Ramen equivalent to a $0.25 pack of dehydrated noodles I could have bought from Safeway!  Am I angry??? Livid!!! I can't spare trivial tasks during lunch and $14 on soup should be a reward not punishment!!!
author: sonia m.

description:
This place is awful. Sorry- but I seriously just spent over $100 with tip for food that wasn't even as good as mall food. In fact- I've had better frozen Lean Cuisine beef teriyaki TV dinners. The meat was fatty, over-cooked, grey and drenched with a sauce that tasted like it was made of cheap maple syrup and soy sauce. The salad dressing was basically just mayonnaise. The miso soup tasted like it was instant. The gyozas were similar to the ones at Trader Joe's. The 4 sushi rolls that we had were ok, but they only gave us 3 packets of soy sauce and included utensils for 4 people. 

Also- this is the last time that I'm ordering from Eat 24. Most of the restaurants on there are terrible, and so is their service. They NEVER pay attention to special request. And- Eat 24's customer service is nonexistent. 

There are so many more options in this town that deliver. Eat 24 needs to step up their game already.
author: Bobby C.

description:
Pretty good delivery from eat24. Today's order was flawless. 

Their unagidon is delicious! Very tender and buttery eel.
author: J L.

description:
It's a bit difficult for me to review SF establishments sometimes as I often compare not only food quality but pricing and ambiance as well; however, I have to take into account of the area I'm in and bang for your buck structure.

I had a "super sushi combo" for $11.95(?) plus tax---my total was $13 flat. It included 18 pieces of sushi which is quite a lot for the price, but as I expected, the pieces were really small, which is okay.
author: Gabriel D.

description: The sushi  was okay. I spend $80 and tbh it was mall sushi. Nothing fancy. Place needs a remodel and a new chef. Rice was dry. Cheap on the fish. Overall, I probably wouldn't return.
author: Sean V.

description:
Just ordered this for delivery. Amazing food.  Tasted amazingly and food was packed perfectly and hot. Got dragon roll, chicken udon, and chicken teriyaki.  

The dragon roll was delicious and I loved it. The chicken Teriyaki was good and the dressing and salad was delicious and it came with miso soup that was awesome. The udon was epic, it came with the soup and chicken in a container and the noodles and veggies were in their own container which kept them super fresh. 

In all loved the food.  Will definitely get it again. Very happy. :)
author: David B.

description:
First of all, my delivery arrived after 1 hour and 20 minutes, instead of the indicated 45-60 minutes. And no traffic or bad weather conditions at that time, which could have affected it! 
Then, they've forgotten to put rice in my order! 
And the miso soup was very weird tasting - had carrots, fried onions and zucchini in it. Definitely not an original miso soup, never-ever I had one like that... DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!
author: Katerina T.

description:
Wow. If anyone had told me that Japanese food could be awful, just infuriatingly bad, I wouldn't have believed them. 

Is "zaoh" Japanese for "regret"? Gummy, heavy tempura, watery soup with a strange metallic aftertaste: My stomach is full of blah food and resentment. 

Waste of time and $$. Won't ever be back.
author: Tracy B.

description: Bravo! I just got the sushi sampler delivered and was a surprising spread and great experience. Best delivered sushi I've had hands down.   Skip the soy and wasabi and enjoy what they have put together.  Compliments to the chef!  Thanks!
author: Danielle T.

description:
Ordered delivery today. 
Chicken teriyaki was awful. Impossible to eat. I had to eat only the plain rice. Chicken with a lot of fat and no properly cook. 
Sunomono it was fine. Gyoza it was burned in one side, couldn't finish the 6 piece.
The miso soup it was delicious and the ginger too.
I can tell I put on trash a 30$ ordered food.
Two stars because delivery time it was fine and the miso soup + the rice saved my lunch.
author: Fernanda E.

description:
Assorted Sashimi (4 varieties) are delicious and creative. We also ordered some rolls and the tuna poke salad, the R&J roll ( not on the mean, so you have to ask for it) was one of the best I've ever had that had to order one more. Both are good quality fish, fresh and yummy with reasonable prices.  

Highly recommend this place
author: Liyuan W.

description: Honestly not bad for delivery sushi. Ordered last minute via Yelp and only afterwards did I realize I had made my order 15 minutes before the restaurant closed. I was thinking maybe they'd straight up cancel my very large order but they didn't and the food was deviled fairly quickly. Solid delivery sushi, good portions, would order from them again!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Let me just say - I did NOT go to the restaurant, so I don't know how the restaurant is itself. But I did order delivery on Yelp Eat24. It was amazing! The restaurant confirmed it for 45 minutes ETA and it actually arrived a couple minutes early! The lady that delivered was nice and quick, so my Chicken Udon was still piping hot when it arrived. But it was a Saturday, so I'm thinking that not very many offices are open to order from a restaurant in the SoMa district.

The udon and broccoli were a little soft. But the chicken was great - it was super hot and soft. It wasn't softy and the soup didn't make me extra thirsty, like some soups normally do.

The Yakitori Side Dish was chicken and that was delicious with it's sauce as well. There was so much sauce that I ordered a side of brown rice so I could mix it into the sauce, which turned out great too. The chicken was tender and tightly compacted onto the skewer, so it was a bit of a challenge to get it off the skewers at first, but still good.

The Unagi Hand Roll wasn't my favorite and there were little bones still in the unagi, which was unpleasant. Not too big of a deal, but I wouldn't order it again.

I'll definitely order again very soon - especially once I'm allowed to eat sushi again.
author: Athena C.

description: chef very good！perfect sushi combo.  should try the Fracisco roll and the double roll
author: Jieying X.

description: This place has huge portions! I ordered the beef and chicken teriyaki and the food came out piping hot. The rice is addicting. I'm not even a fan of rice! Their cabbage salad with homemade dressing is tasty and light. The teriyaki sauce isn't too sweet and perfectly savory. The place is a bit small and can get crowded at lunch so come early!
author: Marlene T.

description: Order food from grubhub. The food is good. Delivery guy only took 20 minutes come here . It's fast. Definitely will order again
author: Clancy Y.

description: Unfortunately, had a similar experience to another reviewer here. Delivery came super late, got no update from the restaurant in the process. No bad weather, no traffic, and only ordered sushi so....no cooking either. Oh, well!
author: Kellee S.

description: Not that bad. Got it delivered from door dash. I liked it. They wrapped my chicken teriyaki in foil so the sauce would make my tempura soggy.  love that idea. people are complaining the chicken being really fatty, it's thigh with skin on. I've been places where they burn it. It was cooked nicely. Also gave a lot of different variety of tempura veggies than most places. My dad certainly enjoyed it. Sashimi's were pretty fresh. Sushi's were basic but still good. Can't complain. I'll def order again. I enjoyed the teriyaki chicken. I like a lot of sauce so I can mix it in with my rice. And if you don't do that, you're eating it wrong. Sooo.
author: Gillian Gail A.

description: So great! Good was correctly packaged to ensure optimal eating experience at home! Yelp app quoted me at an hour delivery time but food arrived in 30 minutes! On a Friday night mind you. Will most certainly be ordering again!
author: joselyn b.

description:
Super convenient for me, so I will definitely return, but the food is only okay. I ordered the lunch combo with tonkatsu and vegetable tempura.

The tonkatsu:
- Breaded well
- Not good pork though - had a bit of a funny taste

Vegetable tempura:
- Not melt in your mouth good, but the batter was not bad
- The vegetables seemed to be fresh enough

The price is great though, I got tonkatsu, vegetable tempura, rice, soup, and salad all for less than $15 pickup.
author: Andrew T.

description: You can't believe how awesome the food before you try it!! Especially, the Happy Hour time is great for the young people because there are many items to be much cheaper~ if you like to hangout with friends and want to have a drink, you can't miss this time to get a chance of buy one beer or sake get one free!! By the way, don't forget try the rolls and sashimi~ everything is fresh and deliciousthe service is great too!
author: Chia-Hang C.

description: A decent place to have sushi. It's a very cheap spot to get a decent sushi. Staff is nice. They always welcome you and say good bye every time you come and leave. Kinda cute gesture.
author: Sumbal A.

description: I ordered a zaoh sushi boat, their sashimi is very fresh and the driver is really fast!
author: Kelvin Z.

description:
ZERO STARS
Tbh first time using it and was sooo scary and bad. This was when Grub hub bought Eat 24.
STORY TIME:
 I order the food to my college campus because it's late night and everything is too far to get food. The food took an hour but as soon as I went to go get the food the driver demanded a tip. Now am a 19 year old female scared to death because it's 11 pm and this man is obviously mad and demand a tip. So I gave him the tip but then he told me sign a paper. Being scared i did. Realizing that I didn't know what I just signed I texted the customer service. 
Basically they had to start a whole investigation because that is not something they do. Next thing you know am at a cafe and my card was canceled due fragility activity on my account that Bank of America noticed and canceled. 
 Jump a month ahead of the incident they say that I need to call in because my order doesn't show. Like get your crap together and I want a refund. I do better using POSTMATES.
author: Karen-Symone L.

description:
This place use to be amazing. Under new management. They are not doing the good that was served there any justice. Such a-shame
I had eating there for about 25 years under old management and was never disappointed. 
To bad, I won't be going back under this management.
author: Myra A.

description:
This one's long overdue.  I love this place for lunch!  Their delivery service is super quick and their food is tasty.  Their sushi isn't the best that I've had, but delicious nonetheless.  I love their lunch combo, I usually get the teriyaki chicken with salmon sashimi, you can never go wrong with that combination.  

To be honest, their food is about a 3.75 star, but their delivery service bumps them to a 5 star rating because (most times) it takes them less than 30 minutes to arrive;  and during lunch break, every minute counts.  If you do dine in, they're just as fast to getting food to your table.  Love this place!
author: Jen M.

description: I just ordered couple of lunch menu such as super sushi combo and beef teriyaki for delivery. I am very disappointed for the price I paid. I don't see any value to my money. The super sushi combo is not delicious and it is yelling to my head that I was ripped off for paying more than $30 plus tip. Their beef teriyaki is also a disappointment it's chewy and not tender. Overall the food is lousy, I will not buy here again. Do not be fool by free delivery.
author: De N.

description: Buy one get one free sake? Incredibly fresh and affordable sushi / sashimi. Hospitable and welcoming Staff grace this hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Don't let its small stature and intimate setting turn you away. Wonderful
author: Drew R.

description: it's been awhile since I ordered from them, but they NEVER disappoint! Food is excellent. This time I actually ordered for myself and a coworker. I ordered the California and Rock & Roll Sushis and she ordered the Beef Teriyaki lunch (comes with rice and soup) and we were both pleased, full and happy! Excellent, Service is always friendly as usual!
author: Sakkara C.

description: I was told the business was sold; well, I hope is just as good as previous business;   So, I ordered a lunch 2 items combo-Beef teriyaki / shrimp tempura lunch; i couldn't believe what I was looking at; I asked, where's the beef???  The beef was tasteless and tiny portions of beef.  OMG, This is not worth the $$.   And I asked for brown rice n waitress served the order w white rice, ugh...not going back there again!
author: Ms R.

description:
The restaurant is in between Grandma's deli and Shanghai Restaurant. You wouldn't really notice it unless you're walking by. They're usually packed and the only reason we went there after a training nearby and coworkers has told me this place was good.

We walked in and we were seated right away in the back, it was pretty small. We had hot tea and our menus. We ordered our food and the food came, but we also ordered drinks.. a diet coke and root beer. We had to ask couple of times before the waitress FINALLY brought over the sodas. I ordered a seaweed salad that NEVER came... and was on the check! Had to get the seaweed salad off the check. 

Waited forever to get our box and check. Onto the food, the food was mediocre, I've had better. At first, I didn't know... *wait for it..* a CHINESE owned Japanese restaurant... yeah, are you surprised?

We asked one of the waitress if they had gluten free soy sauce, she said YES. We were SHOCKED! Then we waited for a long time and she never came and asked another waitress for soysauce, she came back with a GREEN top (low sodium). She said that's all we have....... hmm.... OK. 

For a first timer.... I'd say it's my last time.
author: Eugenia W.

description: I ordered a California roll with crab added (they forgot to add crab and I paid for it), rainbow roll and a spicy tuna roll. All the fish was poor quality and they only added two small soy sauce packets in my to-go bag for 4 rolls! Not a good experience. Would not recommend trying Zaoh restaurant.
author: Brandon W.

description: This is my favorite place for lunch near my work place. The lunch combo is really valuable. The chef and server are all really nice. I will definitely introduce to all my friends!!!!!!
author: Angela C.

description:
3.5 stars

I've been to this spot twice, partly because there are surprisingly few good sushi spots in Soma. It's definitely a hole in the wall but the sushi selection and service are good. The restaurant was pretty empty on the weekend, but I'm guessing that's because the location is out of the way if you don't live or work in Soma.

The menu here is pretty standard, and I've been happy with my order both times. If you're just looking for a quick sushi fix, this is not a bad choice.
author: Connie Q.

description: I love this restaurants food special seafood udon Susi are very fresh and delicious service are very good too
author: Al H.

description:
I love coming here. The food is a little bit more expensive ~$13 for a lunch combination but it's worth it. I tried their special spareribs today and it was juicy and soft. I didn't even need to use a knife to cut it, the fork went through it like butter. Their rice tea was deep and aromatic. 

A good place for individuals , pairs, or groups of four. 

My usual order for Zaoh is their Beef Teriyaki and salmon sashimi, but when I am super hungry I get two Beef Teriyaki. 

It's a fun menu; i really like their rock and roll roll too.

Enjoy

-BlackTiger

Back at it again with the double beef teriyaki!
author: Teason M.

description: This is Japanese restaurant I have eaten the most delicious, especially sashimi and sushi,reasonable price,I will often come to eat
author: Amy H.

description: We ordered from this place through DoorDash and had the worst possible experience.  Our order took over an hour to arrive.  When we open the bag, the order was wrong!  Several items were missing from a combination order, another item was completely different from what we ordered. We called the restaurant and spoke with an incompetent staff person who just said "oh sorry" and asked that we call back after she spoke with a manager. We called back and were told the delivery person must have lost the food and there was nothing they could do!  What??  Clearly they prepared the wrong food and are not taking any responsibility.  I would never order from this place again for their mistreatment of customers.
author: Patrick L.

description:
My coworker and I split a tempura udon and the super sushi combo for lunch. The food was very reasonable for the price (~$20). It was yummy and its the best sushi option in the area unless you're rich enough to eat at Twitter's market. 

There's lots of tables for eating there. Furniture is a little fun down but still good atmosphere for eating a casual lunch with a coworker.
author: Mimi T.

description: This place is right down the block from where I work so is it my go to spot for lunch. The service is usually really quick and the women there are very friendly.
author: Emperatriz M.

description:
Business was just sold off recently, I've been going here since the mid-90s. Typical Chinese-run Japanese restaurant, food about average. Pretty much always you can get a seat, staff is friendly and efficient, portions are okay. Lunch combo bentos now cost near the mid teens, the chicken is fairly tasteless, the beef very tough like leather with teriyaki permeating it. However, cabbage salad is awesome and their tea and soup are pretty good. Rolls won't blow you away but they aren't the worst. Tempura is very greasy and heavily battered, but it does taste good.

For the neighborhood it's a safe bet when you want a reasonably filling and friendly sit down meal for under $20.
author: T J.

description: We used Eat24 to get the food delivered. It was an easy and quick. However, the fish wasn't too fresh... My husband was hungry enough to finish his chirashi bowl but I have more than half of my sashimi and sushi combo left in the fridge (will probably never finish it).
author: Grace M.

description: Amazing food! Came here looking for some grub before a concert and stumbled upon this awesome place! Beef udon was amazing! Great broth and delicious noodles! Will definitely have to stop by next time I'm in town
author: Nathan S.

description:
This place is wonderful. Small but cozy, nice, friendly and attentive staff..but most importantly, their sushi is on point! I don't want want to call myself a sushi snob..but I've had my fair share of fresh sushi. Not only is the price fair for Japanese food in SF's Soma District, or just about anywhere in SF but their food rocks. It was my first time trying this place out and I'm definitely going to be back. 

Notable items to order (imo):
Spicy Tuna Roll
Amaebi Nigiri
Tekka Sashimi
Lion King Roll (not on their menu)
Dragon Roll 

Try it out and you will taste that fresh fresh! Eat good, live good. :)
author: Amy C.

description:
My first experience for take out today. I ordered  the soft shell crab, unagi over rice & salmon skin hand roll. Came to be about $30+ dollars after tip. I thought that the price was about average and I went to pick up my food. 

Soft shell crab..:
It was pretty good. Only bad thing about it was that it was a bit soggy.. but I had to walk 10 minutes with it in its box so I understand. Besides the soggyness, I was very pleased.

Unagi over rice. (Eel):
The reason I ordered the soft shell crab in the first place is because I thought the portions weren't going to be much. I was totally wrong. Unagi over rice was enough to fill me all the way up. The eel itself was very juicy and it tasted awesome. 

Salmon skin handroll: 
This was expected that it will be a bit soggy because of my travel back to work. But the handroll is very good. 

I will definately come back to Zaoh.!
author: Crystal L.

description: I use to eat here years ago and it was good sushi! I had take out tonight spent a lot of money! All I can say is stay away from Anything with crab (real) OOOMMMGGG it's disgusting don't they clean it out! I feel sick to my stomach I took one bite and it made a sick!! I'm angry so I have to throw out over $50.00 worth of sushi!! So disappointed find another place ppl
author: Shalone S.

description: I am first time here. This is old restaurant. Open about 33 years. We are take order on happy hour menu. The price is impeccable. Fresh sashimi and big size. I will come back.
author: Chloe K.

description: Totally a surprise. The food and service was exceptional. Cute hole in the wall and in a great location of the city. GO! It might be the best sushi experience I have ever had.
author: Andrew B.

description: Everything was very good. Clean environment, nice service. The tempura was wonderful. If you like sashimi, try out the red tuna, it's great.
author: Sharon W.

description: I waited 1 and 45 mins for delivery.  I ordered at 5:30pm, called after 6:20 and they told me that my food is on its way.  They thought it was a pick up order.  I purposely put an order in early so it would avoid the busy dining hours.  I only ordered 1 hand roll and yosenabe.  Food was just ok.
author: Sara Y.

description: This is one of our go-to spots for delivery because of the good sashimi, but after a string of sub-par experiences, we'll have to reconsider. The portions started out generous but have gotten smaller over the past three months, and the past few times, the hot food was delivered cold. Last night, we placed our order ahead of time and scheduled delivery for when we got home. The chicken katsu arrived cold and soggy, the sushi rolls with shrimp tempura and soft shell crab were mushy, and the avocado on the dragon roll had oxidized. It was clear the food was prepared at the time the order was received, and then sat in containers until delivery time. We're going to take a break from Zaoh and will reorder in a few months in hopes that we can put it back in our rotation.
author: A S.

description:
Ya know what?  It's really good.  To heck with the haters and Chinese-can't-make-japanese.

The hamachi nigiri was beautifully sliced and melted in my mouth.  The spicy tuna hand roll was tasty and overflowing.  The tempura was piping hot, fresh and the shrimp perfectly cooked.

You could pay double and it not be as good.

The decor is not appropriate for a date.
author: adam s.

description:
I have lived and worked in this neighborhood for over 20 years and have eaten out Zaoh often enough to consider it a neighborhood staple; not good, not bad just there.
I also always believe that you are only as good as your worst meal. Today Zoah seemed to have served up a new low; an inedible bowl of Ramen with a side of chicken teriyaki.
In a city flush with delicious Ramen it amazed me how bad a bowl good be. From the overcooked prepacked (i can only imagine: frozen) noodles to the oily chicken? flavored broth with a few floating pieces of vegetables.
NEVER AGAIN
author: Neil K.

description:
This place was quite good but after this last experience, I will NEVER set foot in this place again.

I have had the soft shell crab roll many, many times.  Normally it is delicious.   

When I ordered it today, it was a completely different dish with no rice, no seaweed and a crab that was way too mature to be considered a soft shell crab.  It was hacked into a million pieces to make it look bigger than it was so as to justify the price.  But in short, it was a terrible tasting and looking dish and nothing like what I have eaten dozens of times before.  

I told the waitress that I was not pleased with my roll and that I would like to return it and order something else.  She looked at me like I was from Mars.  Then she said she had to talk to the manager to see if I could return it and order something else.  I was dumbfounded with her reply.

Then the cook came over (he tried to call himself the chef but he must have been hallucinating).  I explained to him that I did not like the taste of the crab and that I would like to return it and order something else.  This cook then grabbed my plate and started playing with the pieces of crab with his bare hands. He was squeezing the nasty little fried pieces while insisting that it was fresh.  I replied it did not matter if it was fresh if I did not like it.  He stated "I AM THE CHEF" and then threatened me with "I don't care if you don't like it, you will pay for it."  I told him that I would not pay for it, especially since he just played with my food with his bare hands.  I asked him why he was arguing with a customer for not enjoying a plate.  He continued to rant and then told me if I didn't pay for the crab, he would call 911.  I invited him to do so.  The coward never did.

But the restaurant did have the audacity to still charge me for the soft shell crab even though it had been fingered by the cowardly cook and actually taken away from the table so that even if I had wanted to eat it (I shutter and try not to hurl at that thought), I wouldn't have been able to.  

I paid for the food that was eaten and left.  I did not pay for the crab.  No tip of course.  The two indentured servants (aka the poor waitresses working for the cowardly a-hole) followed me out of the restaurant, demanding that I pay for the crab.  I responded that I would not pay and they should do what they had to do but I was leaving.  Of course, as the two work for a coward and have learned from a coward, there was nothing done.  

It's quite amazing to have a restaurant and it's cowardly cook actually tell a customer that they don't care that the customer doesn't like a dish, deny the customer the opportunity to order something else, and then demand that the dish which has been played with by others' bare hands needs to be paid for on top of it.  Mind you, this was a stinkin' $9.50 roll, not a full blown meal.  

Please do not eat at this restaurant.  People like this should not be serving customers.
author: Dyana L.

description: Me and my family did a doordash here. The food was just okie but a lot pricey. we just wanted to try this place out but i would do it again.
author: Hoa T.

description:
This is some no foofy bullshit sushi, no seriously. Most sushi places have all kinds of sauces and stuff on/around the rolls. This was just the roll like it should be. Amazing taste.... YUM!
Melts in the mouth perfectly and gives a foodgasm like crazy! 

Definetly in the top5 fav sushi place!!

Can I get an AMEN for real wasabi?

Miso soup was the only "not that great" thing. But who cares! :-)
author: Styn V.

description: THIS PLACE IS DISGUSTING! Worst food I've ever "eaten" (the food was inedible). If I could give negative stars I would give -10 stars (maybe more). The sushi was legitimately grey. It was disgusting! My friend threw it up almost immediately as did I. They also delivered it over an hour late. The salmon looked like rubber (smelled horrible too) like it had been sitting out for days. There was nothing fresh about this food. I've never gone to such an extent to write a review about a restaurant, nor have I ever had such a bad experience with a restaurant in my 8 years in SF. When I called the restaurant and told them, instead of trying to remedy the situation, they just denied that it happened and claimed we "had allergies or something." I eat sushi 3-4x week, pretty sure I don't have allergies to raw fish (just yours apparently...). After constantly arguing with them on the phone they initially said they would only reimburse me for HALF my order (it was about $100 worth of sushi...). Then when I called back they told me they would only reimburse me a $12 portion of my entire order as they didn't feel like they needed to do more to remedy the situation of sending me shitty stale sushi. These people are pathetic lol DO NOT EAT HERE. It is gross and the customer service is well below the threshold of downright awful. I will do everything in my power to make sure others don't get scammed by these people as they have no idea what they're doing and would prefer people get sick instead, which is what my friend is right now. All of the food had to be thrown away cuz it smelled so fishy, SO GROSS!!!
author: Frank P.

description:
They delivered my order without wasabi or ginger. I'm glad I left the delivery driver only a $1 tip.

Pay more attention next time.
author: Nathan P.

description: It seems like maybe I had an off day since the other reviews are good. I couldn't finish the salmon sashimi. It was really fishy, but also tasted sort of fake in an odd, oily way. I am not too picky with sushi, but I actually couldn't swallow this.
author: g b.

description: A great out of the way sushi joint. Fresh sushi to order and nice service. Reasonable prices
author: Katherine L.

description: Amazing food delivery Restaurant and even the tempura was delivered light and crunchy!!
author: Shannon E.

description: I ordered assorted sashimi for toady's lunch. It was fresh and delicious. They have blue fin tuna which is very nice especially for the price. I'm appreciate their patient service. It's a little crowded at the lunch time though.
author: Jianfu L.

description: Great rolls, fresh and of good size. The prices are humane as well. A little crowded during lunch.
author: Alena N.

description: My go-to Japanese restaurant on Grubhub. Ordering is easy, the delivery fast and always with a smile. Most of the food is great, especially the rolls, though some of their sashimi isn't that good so keep that in mind. Try their mango roll!
author: Nadine A.

description: A friend recommend Me to this restaurant. Its small not easy to find. First time to try this restaurant And i am surprise for the sashimi quality. Fresh Uni And salmon . The restaurant is quiet. You don't need to wait for seat And the food come very fast. Reasonable price. I definitely will come again
author: Keith T.

description:
Allow me to review the CA Roll w/ Real Crab & the Golden Gate Roll! These rolls were delicious! I ordered from Eat24 and although the time was quoted 45-60 minutes, it came in under 30! The delivery man was really nice! 

I know these rolls are pretty basic, but they deliciousness! And believe it or not I've had these rolls from other places that really messed them up! These were full of flavor and overall im pleasantly surprised! Would definitely recommend!
author: Ari L.

description: My son loves sushi, we were visiting the city with my mum who was here from Scotland. This wee neighbourhood restaurant was just what we were looking for; no frills, fresh sushi at great value. Our host was very attentive & friendly. The portions were generous and the lunch combo specials were great value. They had a daily specials board too; California rolls with fresh crab, just $7.50; tempting but we stuck to the menu. This place is a little off the tourist route, but totally worth the wander on a nice sunny day like we had. Lunch for four with 3 large beers and tip $108
author: Kirsty H.

description: Surprisingly very good for lunch.  $9.95 for a regular chicken teriyaki plate.  I went with the slightly more expensive $11.95 combo that included several pieces of california rolls.  Decent rolls and tender chicken breast with crispy skin, although it was slightly too sweet/salty since it was doused heavily with teriyaki sauce.  All entrees comes with miso soup, salad, and rice.
author: Karen L.

description:
Lovely, cozy place. Prompt and friendly service. I ordered a miso soup, an Octopus Rolls and White Tuna Rolls. Both were pretty good (Really couldn't have asked for more for a $4.50 portion!) I do wish they added some seaweed in the miso soup though. It's still delicious nonetheless.

Next time you're downtown and crave some non-rip-off Japanese food, spend an extra 10 min to catch a bus/train down here. It's worth it!
author: Michelle B.

description:
Considering the rating the food should had been better. So came here on a Saturday when most places around here are closed so options are limited. Looking at their menu there really isn't much of an option for Japanese food, more just what kind of chicken, pork and tempura. 

So I decided to play it safe with the sesame chicken. The bean sprouts that they brought to the table already had a bug. The food was horrible.

Something simple had so many mistakes. The miso soup had potatoes and carrots. And when my sesame chicken arrived, the rice was over-cooked and the chicken was a flavorless defrosted chicken breast with teriyaki sauce sesame poured on top after cooked.
author: M C.

description:
Intersecting.

Outside: Five lanes of traffic.

Inside: Succulent gyoza, unique octopus and dried gourd rolls, fresh salmon and yellowtail nigiri and an overwhelming in size and taste soba noodles with chicken.

Washed down with one very large beer. All served by an attentive and kind staff in a perfunctory space that was just right for eating and conversing.

By the end there were very full stomachs and leftovers. There was also a bill that somehow came to just $55 with tax and tip.

Zaoh takes the high road.
author: Jason B.

description:
Experiences like these make me wish Chinese-owned Japanese restaurants were outlawed. The "beef don" I ordered one night was a joke. I imagined traditional thinly-sliced beef simmered with soft onions. What I got instead was thick slabs of chewy beef thrown in dark sauce, and hey, let's add some raw onions into the mix. Barely edible. So was the tempura that was so dry and coarse that I took one tasteless bite and spat it out. Please people...stick to what you know.  And Tina S., we are on the same page girl.

On a brighter note, fast delivery, and the man seemed sweet and friendly so I'll toss in an extra star.
author: Jen E.

description:
I'm going to be honest, I'm an Authenticity Nazi when it comes to Sushi. 

I like my sushi fresh, simple, and not hidden under all that orangey mayo crap that hides poor quality fish. And as high-maintenance as this may sound, I prefer to only go to Japanese owned and operated  sushi restaurants (Zaoh is Chinese-owned) like Koo, Kabuto and Okina. However, lunch offerings and good ones at that are VERY scant in the Civic Center area so I find myself at Zaoh once every 1-2 months out of convenience. I've probably dined and got take-out a total of 10-12 times with my most recent visit today for take-out. 

I'll keep this review short and simple:

P R O S:
*SOLID BENTO BOXES (2 items - $10.95): My go to is the chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura/veggies. The chicken teriyaki is tender, savory, sweet and smoky and the tempura is lightly and crisp.

*Friendly service

*Food is ready within 10 minutes

*Free Delivery with a $15 minimum

C O N S:
*MEDIOCRE SUSHI: Fish isn't very fresh (well to my standards that is) and the sushi rice lacks a sticky consistency and crumbles. Fyi, I ordered the Dragon Roll ($12) today and the shrimp tempura was mushy, the rice fell apart when I picked it with chopsticks and was slathered with Kabayaki sauce (sweet soy glaze) which made it overwhelmingly sweet.

*Sketchy Area (If it weren't for all the city and government employees walking around the area during lunch, I would not come here.)

If you're looking for more refined and authentic Japanese dishes and sushi in the area, pay a visit to O-Toro Sushi (they also have Izakaya) in Hayes Valley, a 5 minute walk from Zaoh. Although it's Chinese owned, the Chef is Japanese and the food far surpasses Zaoh's in terms of taste and quality.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I ordered take out from this place. One star goes for how quick they delivered. A quick delivery  is always appreciated, and the man was really friendly. However, the sushi is not the best...something tasted really odd/off. I ordered California rolls, Shrimp tempura rolls, gyoza, and shrimp tempera. The gyoza and the shrimp tempera, so another star for that. The sushi itself, on the other hand, I've definitely tried better. But i do recommend the gyoza and shrimp tempera. Overall, I paid $44. Kinda expensive, but probably because it was delivered.
author: Vee N.

description: People need to get over their trendy fixation and get in here!  It's got a cool 80's nu-wave vibe and the employees are really friendly.  This is one of the best places in town to take the folks I work with who have developmental disabilities...they usually can't afford Japanese food but this fits their budgets, especially for lunch.  It's a really great place to eat before going out in SOMA too, low key and cozy.
author: Kooky B.

description: Excellent food. Generous portions. Enjoyed chicken teriyaki, uni roll, salmon sashimi, salad, and mango mochi.
author: Roland C.

description: Best place for Japanese Food!!! Been coming here for years and it's hands down my favorite Japanese spot.
author: G R.

description: Only tried their lunch combos so hard to write much. I think i need to go back to Japan to see what Japanese food tastes like. Japantown has more authentic Japanese food but I can't get that far and back during my lunch break. May have to try the sushi to see what their best dish is.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
Service is decent 
Place is okay. Looks like it hadn't changed since the 80s. Speaker system sounds like it hasn't changed since the 80s too.

Food is edible and cheap. Clearly nothing is freshly made. We had a lunch combo and a futomaki. Avocado was so hard you couldn't stab it with a chopstick. Chicken was clearly microwaved and edible because soaked in teriyaki sauce.
author: Martin S.

description:
Ordered delivery via Eat24 at 1200. Even at peak lunch time, it was in my lobby in 15 minutes. Food was still hot, and the man delivering the food was very kind. A little hard to understand, but still very friendly.

Not a fine dining experience, but if you want chicken teriyaki and a spicy tuna roll delivered to your work... they get my recommendation.
author: Derek L.

description: Ordered in advance on E24. Delivered right on time to my office. The lunch combos are EXCELLENT and tons of food! I got a shrimp tempura combo with sake sashimi - included salad, rice and soup. The maguro was also great. Excellent value and portions for a fast casual style and lunch delivery sushi option. Will be back!
author: Michelle W.

description:
I pass by this place everyday on my way home from work and it's always empty. Today, I decided to give it a shot and walked in at 7:30 pm. The shop had exactly zero customers. I was served hot tea and some sort of bean sprout. 

The staff are Chinese so this is might not be "authentic" enough for some of you. Where I grew up 99% of sushi shops were Korean owned and operated so this doesn't bother me. The waitress stood quietly in the corner until I looked up. This waiting style is typical among most Asian shops.

I ordered a Caterpillar Roll and Salmon Sashimi which arrived promptly. The dish was beautifully decorated. I've had a lot of sushi in my day and I can honestly say this tasted great. But perhaps the timely manner and attention to detail are the result of me being the only customer in the shop. The only other person who entered during my dinner purchased a bowl of rice and soy sauce to-go. I asked for the check and received two slices of ripe orange.

There's nothing special about the decor or furniture. The plate I was served food in tended to protrude near the center and would spin when I touched it. My tea cup had a tacky chart that labelled the different sushi types. The music was typical top 40. 

Overall I would say I had a pleasant experience. It's a quiet place.
author: Daniel W.

description: Kind of pricy in general for what it is, but the sushi is consistently good, the lunch special is a great value, the people who work here are really nice. Not much else going on in the area, I'd recommend it for lunch or delivery.
author: Dina G.

description: Was looking for a good sushi restaurant in the Mission, and found this place on yelp. A lot of the reviews for the place within the past few weeks were not too great, so I was apprehensive, but the menu and prices looked awesome so I gave it a shot. This place was amazing! The service was great, our server was super attentive and quick, the food came out quick, and was delicious. The serving was huge for the price! The quality and quantity of the food were great for the price. The restaurant itself is super adorable too. The booths near the window seat are so cozy and its in a really good location. Definitely will be back here when I'm in the area. For three people with full meals and alcoholic drinks the price was under $60! Can't beat that.
author: Jessica G.

description:
I thought I'd give this restaurant a try since it's on my way home from work. I came here on a weekday around 830pm and ordered the Chirashi dish to-go. 

Overall, the dish was quite disappointing since it only came with 5-6 real pieces of fish and cost $20. The dish also came with miso soup and a small wad of spinach but it definitely wasn't worth the price. The fish was very mediocre but not the worst I've had! 

Even though this place is pretty convenient in location for me, I probably will not go back.
author: Lillian C.

description:
Two and a half stars... but not A-OK.  

This Chinese-run Japanese restaurant makes for an affordable takeout or delivered lunch and you should treat it as such.  Free delivery with $15 minimum.  My ten don (shrimp and veggie tempura) and shiro maguro sashimi (white tuna, 6 slices) combo accompanied by salad, rice and soup came to a cool $12, including tax.  Staff were friendly and my food was ready when I arrived. It was looking good.

"Salad" was shredded cabbage that you line the bottom of dishes with and rest tasty proteins on top.  I didn't eat it.

Soup was average.  Chinese deep fried tofu skin was used instead of cubed tofu.  

Two slices of the shiro maguro, from the same cut, were a bit fishy, but the texture was right.  Four slices from another cut tasted less fishy but had an unpleasant texture.  Considering the price, I can't say I'm surprised...at least I know not to order it again.  

The tempura selection was good - two prawns, carrot, zucchini, broccoli, butternut squash, and sweet potato - but some pieces weren't fried through and there was some chewiness to the batter.  Edible and comparable with what I might expect to find at a food court.

I've had the California Roll and Rock n' Roll maki rolls here on another visit, and those are okay.

I'm sticking with O-Toro in Hayes Valley.
author: Erika C.

description: I ordered from 24 hour eats and the food was delivered under 45 minutes.  I ordered the agadashi tofu and the spicy vegetable roll with brown rice and the mushroom roll with brown rice.  They do charge $1 extra for the brown rice which is fine since most places charges $2 extra.  Their rolls were crunchy, fresh and with great flavors.  The agadashi tofu was prepared differently than most Japanese places.  They didn't have a batter on it which was definitely healthier.  The sauce that accompanied the agadashi tofu had just the right touch of lime juice. Everything was quite delicious.
author: Sharon N.

description: I had a beef don and it was pretty good. It's a lot t of food for a reasonable price. I am giving this place 3 stars only because it the food was good but wasn't great. Also, one of my coworkers is a vegetarian and they did not have too many options for her. Overall, I would go back because it's decent food for a reasonable price.
author: Kayla K.

description: I know this place because of their awesome tempura lunch special, which my friend really enjoyed. I enjoyed their ramen soup. This was my first time ordering ramen at a restaurant and I had some trepidations; though the noodle soup was exactly what satisfied me that day. I kept the miso soup bowl to put the bulk of my noodles in so they wouldn't over cook and I could slowly enjoy the dish.
author: Alexander T.

description: I would give it 3.5 stars for lunch menu only.  For $11.95 the bento box is very reasonable.  Cabbage salad, pick two choices.  Most of my friends got the salmon sashimi, teriyaki, rice, miso soup, rice, and cabbage salad.  The salmon sashimi was plentiful and seems fresh.  I had the oyster katsu.  It was really good oysters, five to be exact.  Service was attentive.  We had a party of eight so we called ahead to reserve the seats.  They were so nice to have everything ready.  It was an enjoyable lunch, also very quick!  We lunched within our one hour limit.
author: Helen L.

description: My new go-to sushi spot, down the street from the new office. The people who run it are extremely nice and the sushi is always on point.
author: Ronaldo A.

description: I love the food, but I have ordered delivery a number of times and it is always the same delivery guy and he always calls and makes me come down and get it from him. There have even been a couple of times where he will pull over on the wrong side of the street and make me run across to get it through his car window. He always just shrugs and says he can't find parking. You are delivering food in FiDi, no kidding you can't find parking, but that's kinda part of the gig. Having to go down to the street to get my food defeats the whole purpose of getting food delivered in the first place.
author: Pam J.

description:
Fake miso= dry package + warm water
Fake wasabi= gooey paste of american horseradish and green food coloring
Fake crab= ungodly concoction
Fake sushi= frozen and thawed
author: Max M.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi places for a few reasons:
1. They deliver via Eat24
2. The New Wave Roll which is essentially a Philadelphia roll made with steak-like soked salmon.
3. The service is so nice

This isn't the place to go if you're looking for incredibly high end sushi. But its great when you're looking to get your sushi fix.
author: Noa R.

description: Great sushi! Great tempura! I haven't sat inside to eat, but everyone is always so nice when I go in to pick up my order.
author: D F.

description:
I must've ordered for delivery on an off day because my order came almost TWO HOURS after I had ordered. I was notified through Eat24 that the estimated time of delivery was 45-60 minutes. I wasn't quite pleased with that but shrugged it off and went about with my work (ordered for lunch). I specifically asked for them to call me once they get to the parking lot of the address I had provided so that I could meet the delivery guy outside.

45 minutes rolled by. Nothing. Okay.. It did say 45-60 minutes..

60 minutes on the dot. I am impatient at this point. I call up the restaurant only to be told the driver has left a looooonnngggg time ago. Okay, he must be on his way. I try to be understanding. Maybe there are other deliveries before me.

An hour and 30 fucking minutes later, still nothing! Furious, I call them again and receive the same answer, but promised to call the driver to ask what's taking so long.

A few minutes later, my phone rings. It is the driver, telling me he's outside. About fucking time. He asked for my name and handed me the bag of food, turned his back and walked out of the parking lot. No apologies, no nothing. I am appalled.

For the amount of time I had to wait for my damn food, I would've expected the wait to be worth it. WRONG.

I ordered the chicken teriyaki ramen with a side order of a spicy tuna roll (to make it so my order was over $15 to qualify for a free delivery). My soup was still HOT so you can bet 50 fucking bucks they left not minutes after my last angry phone call. I am pretty sure you can't call this shit ramen. The soup is so bland and tasteless, you'd think I ordered some kind of broth that chicken was boiled in, sans the spices and seasonings. The noodles? God, don't even ask about the damn noodles. And what kind of ramen has carrots and broccoli? Unedible af. The spicy tuna roll, which had a cute little orange star next to it at the menu page that made you believe it's gonna be one of the best sushi ever, ended up to be one of the most shittiest I've had. The rice was dry and all I really tasted was the spicy sauce. No traces of tuna anywhere. I have absolutely no idea why people raved about it. It certainly did not deserve that star icon next to it. The chicken teriyaki looked like it's been cooked a few days before and soaked in teriyaki sauce. Probably just reheated in the microwave before scooping that shit into their little to-go boxes.

I know this is a Chinese-run Japanese restaurant, but they clearly made no effort whatsoever to make it remotely taste like I was actually eating Japanese food. I really wanted to like this place but after this fiasco, best believe I won't even be laying my eyes on this restaurant's name. Thank you and goodbye.
author: Michelle B.

description:
We've ordered from here consistently (17x) since January but won't be again. Last two times the food took about 80-90 min and the hot food arrived completely cold. 

Eat24 phoned the manager but he refused to do anything. That's just a poor decision for a customer that's spent nearly $1,000.

We'll take our sushi craving elsewhere.
author: Mike C.

description:
The have awesome special combo options and the fish is super tasty. 
I usually order at my job through Eat24 and it's here within 30-45 minutes (I usually place pretty big orders and am several miles from the restaurant so this is impressive). The soup will still be hot, the sushi cool, and the delivery guy is really nice. 

The price is very fair as well. I order almost every week, often as a Friday indulgence!
author: Lydia S.

description:
This tiny, unassuming restaurant is located in a neighborhood that seems to have little foot traffic and is barely noticeable when you drive by...

And yet you SHOULD stop and take a closer look:  have a delicious, inexpensive, GOOD Japanese meal in an unpretentious-yet-homey environment with polite service and no wait for a table!!

I also want to point out that this place is WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE.  That's nice...except for when I tripped down the ramp in the back of the restaurant!  I fell HARD on my shin and was in excruciating pain!!  I was also deeply embarrassed and blocking the hallway for other patrons.  The staff could've cared less about me being completely in the way...they immediately came to my assistance, got me a big bag of ice for my wound, as well as a glass of water.  They checked in on me constantly, even though I had a friend who was sitting with me and attending to me.  That was REALLY nice and beyond the call of duty.  And they helped me up and out when my ride got there!  

Aside from the beyond-the-call service, the food was very tasty!  I didn't order anything too novel (shrimp and veg tempura, rock'n'roll, sake nigiri, etc.), but it was delicious, arrived to the table in a timely fashion, and didn't set me back too much cash.  I will definitely be back to try more sushi, probably some more nigiri, sashimi!  If you're in this part of town and looking for a good, simple Japanese meal, this is your spot!  They do what they do very well!
author: Amy L.

description:
I  have been wanting to try delivery from this place for some time but they are closed on Sundays. Last night, after coming from from a biz trip, I decided to give them a call. 

I was extremely happy with the food. The sashimi was extremely fresh. They have a good variety of options on their menu and the portions were generous. The two of us were super stuffed and our total bill and tip came in just under $50. 

This will be my go to sushi delivery place from now on!
author: Mimi T.

description:
I came to Zaoh in desperation for some hot udon to soothe a sore throat and left with a new appreciation for onions--both the green and white varieties. 

Oh, sweet green onion, you saved me from a tiny bowl filled of tofu-flake disaster (the kind you might find in an instant miso soup packet). But I expected you there and you are reliable and for that I love you.

It's much harder to mess up udon soup because, well, noodles. I ordered mine vegetarian, and not tempura-ed, since I was combatting illness (remember?). I was surprised to find it filled with soft, rectangular strips of lackluster tofu. Which I didn't eat. The other veggies didn't taste as fresh but were, again, saved by the onion. I finished my udon strategically by pairing each bite with a piece of onion. 

And then suddenly my skeptical brain had to do a 180 when the sweetest server in the world told me they added the tofu SPECIALLY for me. Which is why ya'll most certainly deserve 3 stars.
author: Taryn T.

description:
Came here and tried the beef don. It was horrible. I couldn't even finish the meat. 

I just don't trust the freshness of the fish after the beef don incident.
author: Tina S.

description: It's not great, but it's there and it's convienent if you're in the area. This area would be closer to becoming a sushi desert if this place didn't exist. The staff is super nice. Even though it's easy to miss and even though it's kind of dingy inside, it's a nice getaway. A lot of people seem to make their way here actually. I like coming here on a particularly cold or rainy day. I like that they start us off with miso soup and some pickled veggies. The super sushi combo seems like a great deal because it's only offered during lunch, but it's actually not that much food. The fish does seem pretty fresh though. I like the udon here too. Again, not spectacular, but hits the spot. The broth is light. The noodles are bouncy. The tempura is lightly golden.
author: Jennifer W.

description: excellent food and super fast. I order on-line and it's at my door in 15 min. With Grub Hub taking up to 2 hours these days this is my go-to delivery place when I want something fast!
author: John L.

description:
This place is not bad for lunch when it's just a hop, skip and a jump, away, especially when I'm craving some hot tempura udon, (i love tempura veggies) it's satisfying enough to warm up my insides on a 40mph windy day like today. And it's perfect when you only get one hour for lunch because the food comes out fast with friendly service.

The pan fried fish plates, sashimi/sushi and combos aren't bad either. Not the best quality sushi grade fish, but it'll do.
author: Heidi L.

description: Me and my family have been coming to this spot for more than 10 years. We can always count on getting really good Japanese Food.  We have also known the waitress for years and she is just the sweetest Lady.
author: JR L.

description: One of the best and affordable sushi place in the City!! love the chicken teriyaki extra crispy!!
author: Em M.

description:
Ive been going to Zaoh for over 20 years and never once have I been disappointed.
Sushi sashimi combo for lunch!
author: Eric S. R.

description:
Wow, I feel I've grown up at Zaoh. The main waitress who is always there (the one with the blue eye shadow) always remembers everyones name.

Since I was 3, she would always greet me "Hello Monica!" when I walked in. I've brought friends here for birthday get togethers, graduations, and other special occasions. 

Now I'm 19, and the quality of food is still the same as it was when I first came in. Yummy food. I always order the Chicken Terriaki / California roll special. I'm obsessed with the salad dressing!
author: Sophia G.

description: I discovered this place when they ordered it at work, and enjoyed the food. I had the sushi lunch platter and it was pretty good.  If I'm in the area next time and want sushi, I'll check it out.
author: a f.

description:
Solid lunch spot. Quick and efficient. One of the best spider rolls I've had.

Interior is nothing to write home about but the food is solid!
author: Navi O.

description: Ordered take-out from here and was very pleasantly surprised. Nothing out of the ordinary but definitely a satisfactory sushi deliver place. I got the California roll and some of their gyoza dumplings which were both very tasty!
author: Addison P.

description:
Zaoh is not a destination sushi spot.

It's no Kabuto or Koo (some of my favorites).

But what Zaoh does do well - that very few sushi places do (let alone food spots downtown)...

is deliver. Literally.

A little while back - I was trying to find a downtown spot that would deliver a note-worthy spread of food for a medium sized group, in the downtown area - around 7:00pm at night.

Most downtown eateries that typically deliver - are closed at night. Or need days notice to deliver.

Not Zaoh. I called the night before, to see if they could put together a spread for about 20 or so people. The man helping me on the phone was extremely helpful and personable. He said that if I placed my order by early afternoon the next day - that they would have it delivered to our destination later on that night- no problem.

And so with a modest budget - I asked the man on the phone to work within our financial constraints and put together a big spread of food for a group of over 20 people. He asked what I wanted specifically - and trusting the sound of his voice - I said that it would be great if he could just put together a nice mixture of rolls, including sushi and veggie,  and to be sure to include some of his favorites. I also ordered a large sized seaweed salad, and a big serving of edamame. 

At just a little before 7, I got a phone call from Zaoh  - saying the food was on it's way. A delivery car pulled up promptly.

A friendly young man emerged from the vehicle, carrying two heavy large wooden boat displays of wowing looking sushi rolls - with ornate leaf shaped wasabi and delicately arranged ginger. 

There was everything from crab rolls, to spicy tuna rolls, to veggie tempura rolls, to cucumber and avocado rolls, and a vast array of other delicious rolls as well. The presentation was beautiful and unexpected.

The rolls were a big success - though the fish, crab, and eel ones - were far more popular than their veggie counterparts. 

The following day - the same delivery gentleman swung by to pick up the unique looking wooden presentation boats.

For the price, portion, presentation, convenience, and reliability of this place - I would recommend Zaoh for a casual-downtown-delivery- group-catered lunch or dinner option.

While their food is far from spectacular - everyone who feasted upon the rolls that night seemed more than pleased, and plenty of photographs were taken of the unique and impressive spread.

Thanks Zaoh - for pulling through.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
the owner is very friendly and i think the quality of sashimi is decent. however, im not too fond of their beef don....it's just not right :/ the beef wasn't as tender as it should be and the sauce is not sweet enough...
the side dishes are good though!

i'd give this place a 3.5 actually. but since i can't do 0.5 and i really don't dig it so i can't give it a 4 star for my beef don lol....
author: Ru C.

description: I eat here quite a bit and haven't gotten food poisoning yet. Friendly staff. Many thank you's.
author: Lou Z.

description: Small whole in the wall with great flavor!! Been coming here for years and thank God the flavor never changes! ! The cabbage salad and the dressing so delish!! The service hasn't changed for years either. The server has been the same kind and welcoming women for years!! Please don't change ever! !!
author: Ana A.

description:
Very poor Japanese. Over boiled tempura, chicken fried with skin on. Gross. 

Food was very oily. Left a filmy taste in my mouth. Overpriced for the quality when compared to similar restaurants in Japan town. 

Would never come back.
author: Robbie M.

description:
Truth be told, I was a little hesitant to have lunch here.  The neighborhood is...ok but from the outside the place looked run down and there was graffiti on the window (not their fault).  The carpet inside was really worn and airflow was not great.  This is not the place a big groups.

All that being said, the food, although basic was quite good.  We had the combo shrimp tempura and California rolls and veggie tempura and teriyaki chicken.  tempura items were crispy and crunchy and the teriyaki was cooked perfectly.   The rolls did not have too much rice and rolled tightly, which I like.

Overall, I would go back again.  I would give it a 3.5 stars so rounded up to 4.
author: Dima L.

description:
Getting my car detailed around the corner at European Collision and i asked for a recommendation for Sushi. From the owner i got about 6 recommendations with detailed descriptions of all. Hold the phone homie, i just want some good quick sushi. 
Zaoh was it. the Sashimi was super fresh and the seaweed salad was awesome. my girlfriend got Unagi and some udon. The udon was not the best i have every tried but  it was really good. All this really cheap and with very nice service. There is one server in there that i swear is on meds she is so happy and appreciative.
author: Cathy M.

description: I've been coming here forever and their food always hits the spot! Love their chicken teriyaki and tempura combo! Their cabbage salad--yum! brought many family and friends to this place and they all love it. Sharita the waitress and the cooks are all so nice!
author: Robin P.

description: Worst restaurant experience I've ever had.  The salmon was not edible and the tuna tasted spoiled.  Been beyond sick for the past day and a half and unable to even go into work.  Avoid this place like the plague!!
author: Ryan B.

description:
a very mom/pop feeling kinda Chinese owned Japanese food restaurant. Needed something to fill my stomach before all the drinking began next door. An interesting find actually. The flavor is about standard. can't say it stood out but it seems fresh and the selection is enough on the menu. the server is really nice and very attentive. and the food came pretty fast to feed my hungry tummy. 

If im looking for a quick bite in the area, I wouldn't mind stopping by again.
author: Ai L.

description: This was a complete surprise.  They delivered really delicious sushi and Japanese dishes (teriyaki and tonkatsu) very quickly, and warm!  Friendly delivery guy also
author: Chris E.

description:
Nice staff and great location central to lots of hot points along SOMA!
My friend celebrated her bday here and they accommodated a big group of 15. The staff was attentive  so nice to us and even helped us cut up the cake!
The sushi was good-we ordered two boats.
I would come again if I were in the area.
author: Patricia M.

description: My friend's roommate had her birthday dinner here so there were quite a few of us who had taken over the front table. We were so loud, the other patrons had to sit in the back. That said, we ordered so much sushi we had two boats! I ordered a combo and so did my friend because we eat very little sushi to sustain that much food. The staff were very helpful despite the fact that we took over a large table for a pretty good amount of time. They even let us bring in a cake for the birthday girl. We paid about $500 all together. It's convenient to walk to the clubs in the area as well. They didn't add gratuity even though our party was about 15 people. The food was decent and I'd probably go here again if I were in the area.
author: Amy J.

description: Best sushi place in San Francisco by far! The fish is always so fresh. Be sure to try the fatty tuna. Everything my husband, and I have ordered from here has been delicious. Spider roll is amazing, loved the chicken teriyaki, the tempura is very good. It's now the only place we will order sushi from anymore.
author: Karleen K.

description: I love their specialty rolls and have always had great experiences with their delivery!
author: Kate D.

description:
This place is a decent lunch spot. I usually order to go so often they recognize me now. I usually order a combination box for the boss, and for me I tend to go with the Nigiri Sushi plate. Their sushi is okay at best but for a call in order of 10 minutes or less, I'll take it. Their customer service is very friendly and it is usually very busy during lunch hour. After 2pm it usually dies down and you get your food incredibly fast!

One thing is the soup to go is always tongue burning hot! Its a good thing if you arent immediately drinking it. So fair warning on the soup but otherwise most of their menu is decent. One of the more decent spots for quick japanese food during lunchtime.
author: Derek N.

description:
The worst Japanese restaurant I have ever been in my entire life. Here is everything I can think of:

Outside: Dirty, Faded color pictures, Shitty Graffiti
Tea: Plain, taste just like water
Miso Soup: Doesn't taste like miso soup
Tempura: Extremely Oily
Beef Teriyaki: The beef is ok but the sauce doesn't taste like Teriyaki sauce, it taste more like soy sauce
Salad: The sauce wasn't extremely terrible but the vegetable is so bad.
Sushi Rice: Old and cold rice got squeeze into flat
Fish: Really old and weird
Tableware: Looks like have been used for 20 years. First time I avoid using a spoon in a restaurant
Price: Overpriced
Service: Bad, they don't even speak English well. Can't even describe one of the item I asked on the menu. They speak Chinese very loud in the restaurant.
Sushi Chef: Not Polite at all. Keep using fingers to hit my menu to point out something (but useless) while I was reading.

Pros: None
author: Jerry Y.

description:
Mmmm...MANGO SUSSSSHHHHIIIIIIIIII

Delivered! Seriously, how the hell do you get better than that??

We ordered enough food for 4-5 people, indictative from the amount of chopsticks they gave us (two people). We ordered a crapload of nigiri, but they gave us imitation crab for one of them!? Mango sushi, the 49er roll, and two other rolls (8 pieces of each) that were absolutely DELISH. We also ordered two things of the cabbage salad, vegetable tempura, edameme and rice. YUM! Out of all of them, though, my favourite was the mango sushi. Did I mention the mango sushi? Oh by the way, the mango sushi. You should get it.

:D :D

PS: Cabbage salad=da bomb diggity with their dressing.
author: Jaime L.

description:
OMG!  Great sushi here.  Quality and portions are great!  They also offer some Chinese/Japanese dishes here.  Sesame chicken = savory, slightly sweet and delicious chicken (and not just batter.)  

Service is friendly, but of course they are Chinese...so Cantonese or English works.  

Prices are low to moderate, depending on what you are craving for.  They have great sushi rolls, hand rolls, rice entreees, soups, noodles and combinations boxes.  They have some vegetarian options as well.  Instead of the sterotypical green salad though, they have an interesting delicately shredded cabbage salad...yeah, you'd have to try it first before deciding!  

They do accept credit cards, which is a plus for me...as I enjoy lots of sushi (unfortunately for the little fishies out there).   

Ambience = simple, quaint.  Diner-esque without the surliness.  

Area = shady so...I'd suggest you go in a group, or carry a large stick.  

Parking is typical of this area...either a few blocks away near traffic or just bus it.  

I know..this is semi-ghetto of ME but I like the fact that they left a pot of tea on the occupied tables, instead of one lousy small mug waiting to be refilled (which sometimes never happens!)  

Now...go get some yummmy fish!
author: Fannie S.

description: I ordered in and it was wonderful.  Amebi was great.  Hot part was hot, cold was cold.  Everything was fresh and tasty.
author: Lois H.

description:
Summary: Mediocre and not particularly worth it. I come only because it's close.

Okay, honestly, I think it's very mediocre. I think it's telling when a place  charges you for extra wasabi or extra ginger.

The fish quality is mediocre and portion size is kind of small. While I don't expect food to be chinese food prices, I also don't expect it to be uber expensive. 

=X I'll be back only because the location is convenient. Otherwise, when I don't feel as lazy or when other places are open, this is my last choice for Japanese.
author: Arcee X.

description:
Tho the atmosphere leaves something to be desired, the food, and specifically the sushi, is really solid.  Prices are decent and people were nice.  

We asked the server what she recommended for fish (honestly, people--don't just order the fish, ask what's fresh!) and all her picks were solid.  I really liked the golden gate roll, with tempura shrimp and avocado.

All in all, a nice find in the neighborhood!
author: Dana S.

description:
I have never been to this location so I am only rating this for it's delivery.
Excellent customer service! I just placed a very last minute order to be filled and delivered in an hour.
The owner is very accomodating.
I have not ordered hot dishes from Zaoh but all their sushi seems fresh and the rolls are tasty.
This is a must on any  Admins lunch delivery list.
author: Edi B.

description:
Another work-lunch find in the SOMA area.  It was packed, the place is small but comfortable and plainly appointed.  Food was delivered quickly and with a smile.  

I ordered the sushi lunch combination.
-Miso Soup - good
-Hot tea - fresh and good
-Ice water - thank you!
-Sushi combo plate - nice portion, tasty, simple and only around $8.50.

Would love to try other items beyond the rolls in the combination plate.  Not a bad lunch spot.
author: Catherine W.

description:
Quick delivery.Tasty food! 

I am on a mission to find the best/cheapest sushi delivery that will come to my home...and I think I've found the place with Zaoh.

I have ordered from this place several times now, and have not been disappointed. Each time I had hamachi sashimi. Each time it was perfect. I have also tried:

Spicy Tuna Roll
Dragon Roll
Spider Roll
Sunomono

Each portion was larger than I would normally expect, and each was made quite well.

Delivery? Never more than 30 mins so far (once was 15mins!). Granted, I do live pretty close by. YMMV.

Prices are reasonable also. However I would ding them half a star if I could for a few minor points:

Crappy, splintery chopsticks
Dyed ginger (meh)
The ponzu sauce is pretty much just soy sauce...I like mine sweeter.

In any case, I'll be ordering again soon. Good stuff!
author: Erich N.

description:
It's the nearest Sushi place by my house. 

The prices are decent. Not super cheap (I would run for my life if I were offered cheap sushi), but not expensive either. 

I've ordered a few different rolls here. The thing that threw me off about this place is how small the rolls are. There are quite a few pieces of each roll but they are very small. The smallest I have ever seen actually. However, the important thing is that it tastes good and everything I have ever had from there has been fresh. No violent diarrhea from old sea food. That's always fun, huh? 

The restaurant is not in a pretty area. Inside the restaurant is just OK. Not even close to fancy, but not gross. It's just right for picking up your takeout order. The lady that helps me is always VERY nice. 

To sum it up, it's an okay place. If I lived in a different area I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. But being that it's a 5 minute walk from my house, it works just fine with me when I have a sushi craving.
author: Liz M.

description:
I am yet to find a good sushi delivery place that does not dissapoint.
This time, I ordered chicken katsu and it was not good at all. Sad. The rice was bad, the salad and its dressing was bad. Salad was like a weird cabbage and the dressing was like a heavy peanut cream. And the miso soup looked weird. And the chicken.. what part of chicken was i eating exactly? it was not a good sight! ugh. i could not eat it, i really tried to!  
i know my chicken katsu and this was not it!
Sigh.I will not be ordering from here again.
On to the next one..

=)
author: C A.

description:
Getting there is half the battle.

It's tricky to find and nasty to navigate in Friday night traffic. But once you get in the door, you'll find a hidden haven for inexpensive Japanese food. I met up with a friend from out of town here. We found the place on Yelp and it was close to our evening plans and we decided to give it a whirl.

You don't go for the ambiance. The place is slightly bigger than a closet. You do go for great menu options, plenty of choices for vegetarians, raw fish enthusiasts and those who prefer cooked items. Saki was lovely, as was my seafood yosenabe. My dining companions enjoyed the asparagus tempura and yellowtail teriyaki, though the fish wasn't as fresh as it could've been. Prices were amazingly reasonable and portions were generous. We didn't have to wait long for any dish to arrive and left full and satisfied. You couldn't find a better hideaway for inexpensive Japanese food.
author: Megan K.

description: We have been going to Zaoh for over 20 years.  We love the food, the people,  & the price.  We also love the low key vibe.  This is truly a hidden treasure in SF.
author: John D.

description: Love this place! The food is delightfuly fresh and arrives hot on delivery. I tell my friends about this place and they have also gone there for dinner which if you go, have a very fast pace and good service.
author: Nyomi B.

description: I didn't have high expectations for this place going in since it's kinda off on the side, away from competition...but I was pleasantly surprised. I had to order my nigiri to go since the location is close to work, but not that close (and I like to savor my sushi). My order came with two complimentary WHOLE shrimp tempuras, with head, legs, and shell still attached. If you've read any of my other reviews, you'd know I'm into that sort of thing. It was crunchy and delicious, but you can tell the oil was a bit old. As for my nigiri: the sake and hamachi were veiny, but fresh and cut think. The amaebi and uni earned my happy points. The wasabi was fermented well and burned so goooood! The restaurant was filled with an amazing aroma so I will definitely go back to try their cooking.
author: Helen L.

description:
Zaoh is within walking distance from the bf's place, so we walked right over to try it out. (Although they do provide a delivery service, which is pretty rad for a sushi spot!) Seriously does not look like an appealing Sushi spot if you were to pass by it, but just order take out and you'll be good. Do NOT leave here without ordering the Butterfish! I'd suggest you order it without the terriyaki sauce. Shit is bomb.

We also tried the Maguro Toro (fatty tuna) sashimi, the 49er Roll (but screw the 49ers, go Chargers! ha) and the Maguro (white tuna) roll. All yummy as well! 

The sushi here was fresh. And seriously, I can not get the Butterfish out of my head. Lol. Enjoy!
author: Felicia G.

description:
