Zaoh's is a gem.  It's not in the fanciest-looking part of town, but the food is really fine and, for Japanese, very inexpensively priced.  No wonder it's usually packed to the gills at lunch hour -- get there a bit early if you would rather not wait for a table.  It can get a tiny bit cramped because of the numbers of tables they squeeze into a not-huge space, but the wait staff is great and I've always found any delay in getting seated to be worth it.  They're also good at handling takeout orders, too.

For the quality of their food and the reasonableness of their prices, Zaoh puts all those Japanese places in the J-Town mall to shame.  Favorite things to order:  the sesame chicken, and the "super sushi combo."
author: moosedog i.

description: Freshest sushi Ive had in SF by far.  I often get delivery, they are fast and very courteous when they deliver.  Their udon and noodles aren't amazing, but everything else is.  They have wonderful combo plates and very fresh nigiri, also their cabbage salad is wonderful!
author: Liz R.

description: Best potstickers! They make the wrappers from scratch. A hidden jewel, especially if you transfer from the Mission bus to a Van Ness bus. We had a fun birthday party for a friend here.
author: marilyn w.

description:
I was having a BAD day (got lost in SF where you are not allowed to turn ANYWHERE).  I spent 40 minutes trying to drive 1.2 miles.  I hate driving in the city.  So when I got home, I was NOT going out again.  And I was grumpy.  And nothing cures my grumpiness like sushi.  

I'm hesitant to order sushi from anyplace that delivers.  I assume I will get crappy sushi.  What kind of sushi place delivers?  But I was desperate.  So I ordered from Zaoh. And it was shockingly delicious (for fairly cheap delivery sushi).  I'm thrilled that I found Zaoh.  I can now have decent sushi whenever I am feeling too lazy to put pants on (well, I probably have to put pants on to answer the door for the Zaoh delivery person, but I definitely don't need shoes...)
author: Meghan S.

description:
Since I wrote my last review, the place have new owners and it has improved ALOT!  Now the driver is doing what he should be doing, dropping off great Sushi, taking the money and going! No more awkward questions, no more asking to use the toilet etc. I've never gotten the other "strange question" dude since my review. 
It's my go to sushi deliver place in SF, and I won't use any one else!!!
PS  - they have a great website with the entire menu in detail.
author: Erica C.

description:
You know what I love more than the street sludge, the loud fights that break out at 2AM in my hood?  

The plump, generous pieces of sushi at Zaoh.   I've never had amaebi, ikura, and hamachi sashimi this good.  Not even at Ozumo, or Ebisu is the sushi this supple, ample, and affordable.  Zaoh is priced like We be Sushi, but much better in quality if you are a hard core nigiri and sashimi fan.  Don't let the shabby interior guide your judgment, order delivery if you can.  They are impressively quick on the draw.  

I guess I can put up with the noise since I live next to Zaoh.  However, fights at 2AM are only acceptable if you are ninjas or 2 hot girls, otherwise, get off my lawn!
author: Xandria S.

description:
Better than they have to be.

Zaoh's is the best Japanese food in this neighborhood; however, they win by default, because there isn't another Japanese food restaurant nearby.  No, wait--there's a Chinese place (Iron Wok) a block away on Market that now does Japanese food, too (I'm not racing to the door on that one).

The ladies here are really sweet and nice, and the food's tasty and fairly substantial (as far as Japanese cuisine goes, which trends small).

Look, they do a pretty good job, it's tidy and friendly, and just because the food's only so-so... I would never go out of my way to eat here, and it's never my idea, but I work a block away with Americans who buy the sushi boxes at Safeway and Trader Joes and even thought they have no taste, I still enjoy their company for lunch once in a while, and I don't find eating at Zaoh's morally repugnant, just kinda "enh."

Ya know?
author: Martin W.

description: Decent Japanese cuisine. Good value for the portion ratio.
author: L T.

description: This place is close to where I work, a neighborhood sorely lacking in decent lunch options.  They give you green tea and a tiny bowl of bean sprout salad when you sit down.  I love those bean sprouts.  Today I had the Saba Shioyaki lunch, which includes miso soup, rice, and cabbage salad.  The Saba (mackerel) was a little dry on top, but not overcooked throughout.  I usually get the White Tuna sashimi which always seem pretty fresh.  The service is very friendly, prices affordable, and you can get in and out quickly.
author: cheryl f.

description:
This is my go-to Japanese place in this neighborhood.  I always get friendly service.  (Actually, it's more like "Hey, how's it going?" service, after coming here for almost two decades.)

The sesame chicken (or teriyaki chicken) and beef teriyaki are always delicious -- thinly-sliced and flavorful.  You can ask for the skin off if you like your chicken better that way.  I usually like the white tuna sashimi with a bowl of rice on the side -- surprisingly filling.  Love their housemade gyoza and dip for the gyoza.  I've got a friend from London who requests this place, just for their bean sprout salad.

Oh, I'm getting hungry again...
author: Christine T.

description:
I have been eating here since I was a fetus. (Literally, my mom ate here when she was pregnant with me) 
The BEST sushi ever. Fresh and fabulous. PERIOD. 
If you are looking for the fancy rolls with ingredients that were never meant to be in sushi, this is not the place for you. But if you want classic fish and the ginger served with it is a pink instead of a yellow (ew), look no further. 
Don't worry, they still make a bomb dragon roll, or even a spider roll, but don't pass up on the rolls with fresh fish! 

Side note: to a couple of the other reviewers, delivery usually negatively affects most food (except for Chinese and pizza)... oh, and the review about the chicken katsu, PUH LEAZE. However, I never order the salad, kind of a holdover from when I was a kid and refused to eat veggies. But their miso soup? THE BEST!
author: Miranda L.

description:
This review is based on customer service.  The food quality is actually good.  

Here's the stupid story.  The first time I went, I got the sashimi bento box.  I asked if I could have half white tuna ($9.95) & red tuna ($11.95).  No problem.  I got charged for the less expensive price.  What an awesome place!!

So I thought.

The second time I went, I got the sashimi bento box.  I asked if I could have half white tuna ($9.95) & red tuna ($11.95).  The woman gave me grief.  I told her that I was allowed to do it last time.  My friend who had been there with me the last time said, "It's true.  I am a witness."  That part was hilarious, actually.  The woman finally said, okay, & charged me $ 9.95 (lower price).  Alright.  Still pleasant but already feeling the inconsistency.

The third time I went, I got the sashimi bento box.  This time, I thought, good grief, I'm just going to make it less complicated.  Maybe it's because the white tuna is $ 9.95 & the red tuna is $ 11.95.  That makes sense.  I would've been totally okay with getting charged the more expensive price both times before.  That seems fair & reasonable.

So I look under the $ 11.95 category & I notice that there's the red tuna for $ 11.95 and salmon for $ 11.95.  Nice.  I ask for half & half.  No problem.  

The bill comes.  $ 13.95.  What the hell????

How did practically the same exact meal come to $ 4 more?  Where in the menu does it say $ 13.95??

I ask the server.  He says that they charge $2 for half & half.  I said, that makes no sense.  The red tuna & the salmon are the same price!  Plus, I never got charged before.

He has the audacity to say, "I don't think so."

Like I was lying.  

But, I mean, c'mon.  $ 9.95 & $ 13.95 is a pretty big difference.  $ 4 pays for gas or tip or the bridge toll.  

I asked, "I wouldn't have ordered half & half if I knew you charged $ 2 extra.  Where exactly does it say that you charge $ 2 extra in the menu?"

"It doesn't.  I'm the one that is supposed to tell you."

"But you didn't."

"No, I forgot.  That was my fault. I'm sorry."

"Sooooo.....  will you take the extra amount off" (DUH, right?  Like I'm a freakin' mind reader.  The dude ADMITTED he made a mistake.  I deserve a refund. Easy fix it.)

"I can't do that."

I swear to God that's what he said.  He said he wouldn't take it off.  At that point I'm embarrassed because I'm with friends & I appear now like some cheap bastard not willing to pay the $2 extra.  But, really, it's the damn principle.  For one, it's about the inconsistency.  It's like every time I go there, the price of my meal is unpredictable.  How stupid is that?  The servers are not all on the same page.  Second, the waiter admitted he was suppose to tell me but he forgot.  I totally don't get it.  It's just so illogical & absurd to me.  It's not on the damn menu!!!!!!!!!!!!  

If they think that it's not a big deal to just like randomly charge me $2, then it shouldn't be a big deal to take that amount off.  

He didn't get a tip.  I mean, OBVIOUSLY.

& I'm disappointed because I thought I'd found a regular sushi joint.  It's convenient because of its proximity.  But I can't see myself going back.  & if I do, I of course have learned my lesson to A. not order half & half and B. ask the total before committing to an order.

The one thing that I do like a lot about this place are separate checks.
author: Yelper Y.

description: Solid sushi. Didn't knock me out the park. I definitely will go again and up my rating if i have another good experience.
author: Rohan S.

description: Best veg lunch- their delicious crunchy fresh cabbage salad and an avocado roll. Only $6 for both. Seriously veg lunch special, get on it!
author: Cori W.

description: Ordered delivery of sushi nigiri.  Delivery was within 30 minutes; service was courteous.  The sushi was okay, with healthy portions of fish and not too expensive, but it really wasn't great.  I'd get Sushi Groove or Ozumo all the time if they delivered and weren't so expensive!  Still searching for a good sushi restaurant for delivery.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Edible!  They deliver too.

Ok, so "edible" might not be the best description for any restaurant, but that's the first thing I think of when I think Zaoh's.  It certainly isn't a knock as I've eaten their food plenty of times.  It's not fancy food, but it definitely is reasonably priced and average tasting for a lot of mid-range japanese places.

I've ordered Udon a couple of times, and the flavors were a bit bland.  I normally stick with the Shrimp tempura or beef teriyaki (or both as a combo).
author: Ulysses M.

description:
I had a rare afternoon off, so I had to find a sushi place Muni accessible, that was open between 2-5. Really hard to find a place open between lunch and dinner. I called first to make sure they stayed open, the man who answered was very warm and friendly.

It was like a block off the the Van Ness Muni Metro station. We walked up and I thought it must be the wrong place. It was a dirty street, graffiti on all over the front, I could not see inside the windows, I thought oh dear, I made a mistake.  

We opened the door and I was pleasantly surprised by a cute, clean little space inside, very different from what I expected from the outside. The waitress was quite to greet us with a smile. 

They have a very basic menu, no frills or fancy rolls. Prices are pretty good for SF. The sashimi was very fresh and had a good taste. The rolls were good. This place was average, but decent quality fish for the price. I am used to fancy rolls with fancy sauces drizzled on top. 

I would come back here if I'm in the area. Maybe even for lunch, it's only 3 stations away.
author: Monica H.

description:
Like always TB always gets to choose where we should share a meal...dont worry I like it that way...he's been around the city for so long that he knows all the good spots...the places that Stevie and I used to go to were great too but its nice to have a bf who knows his way around especially when it comes to food...which he knows that is the "way to my heart"...

I have been to a lot of Japanese Restaurants but I never had a cabbage salad this good...it actually reminded me of the Japanese Restaurant back home...yes Takayama for all of you who knows.

The portions are good not, not too little and not too much...just enough...TB ordered Tuna sashimi which is tasty and very fresh.

The place is too small and we shared it wtih the working class crowd out on our lunch breaks. Service is okay.

You should try it sometime, if not for the sushis just do it for the "cabagge salad"...you cant go wrong.
author: Malou C.

description: Great service, really good fresh simple Sushi. what more do you want. such a hidden little gem.
author: Dennis K.

description:
My family and I come here all the time even though we live in San Jose. It has the freshest sashmi and really great service. It is family run and everyone is really friendly. 

I would recommend the steak, any sashmi, and the yellowtail!
author: Tif L.

description:
I ordered some cucumber rolls (kappa maki) and avocado rolls for lunch today from Zaoh, which is a 2-minute walk from my door. The rolls were ready in under 10 minutes, and the portions were larger than I expected (8 pieces for kappa and 10 pieces for the avocado), and I was glad that I'd ordered only the two instead of the extra kappa maki that I was thinking of. 

The sushi was fresh and well made, and they gave me enough ginger to accompany my rolls and soy sauce in a little container rather than a squirty, leaky pouch. 

Not a terrible lot of vegan options (and I don't know if the tempura is vegan or not), but I'm happy with avocado and cucumber rolls, so if you are too, head over to Zaoh.
author: Jordan P.

description:
This is Zaoh, not Zao. OK? OK.

THE BEST 100% CHINESE Cook but JAPANESE Restaurant in the city!
I don't know the grammar is right.
The BEST JAPANESE Restaurant RUN BY 100% Chinese Cook.
I am trying to say,
The place is 100% Chinese.
But it's a OK Japo restaurant.
But it's the best I've ever been Chinese own Japo restaurant.
But Still Piece of Shit.
SWEET Terry Yucky Sauce for every thing.
But I gotto say the best because ......

I was invited for a family dinner 3 years ago.
The family of my son's good female-friend.
Her mother is a doctor from Russia.
And Zaoh is her favorite place.
She said, right on my face, " I don't care whatyou think, I love the place."
So I said, " So, You don't care what i think, why you telling me for? Asshole."

So, That's that.

The dinner was great.
They had Russian version of Great dumplings for us.
I don't know they call it Momo.
Many vodka. 
The family was very nice to us.
I had a good time.
But,
the mother may be one of those Mayonnaised Mackerel Jiveassroll eater.
I don't think they'll invite me for a dinner again.

The story about the Russian Doctor was real, but I didn't say "Asshole".
And I am provably right about her that Mayonnaised Mackerel Jiveassroll eater.

I really wanted to say, "You are FXXXin' Russian and I am FXXXin' Japo, And you are telling me that you know better than I about Japanese food? FXXX You!"

Yeah, I know, I am such a Jackass, but I was drunk when she told me about Zaoh.
Drinking vodka with Russian was a mistake.
I think I should ask my son to find out that they are still mad about me.

This is Zaoh, not Zao. 
What the FXXX?
But, something about the front door. A Heavy Strong front door that looks so ordinary.

I won't be back. Why should I?
OK, I take it back.
I'll be back only with the Russian family to treat them nice.

Btw, the1st owner was Japanese, 25 years ago. 
Zaoh is Mt. Zaoh in Japan.
Where he came from.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Zaoh is a great place to go for great prices, with a large or medium sized group of friends, since yea it is small, but dead Friday nights. I've only gone after 6pm and haven't ever had a problem with service, they even happily split our check 9 different ways without so much as an eye roll. Although we felt bad about that. 

Anyway, I'd like to give it 5 stars but my favorite types of sushi are the kinds that are battered, condimented up, and more Americanized. They have only 1 roll deep fried, and many choices of the more 'normal' rolls, you know, like spicy tuna roll, unagi etc. Overall good service, good location, great prices, and small place. I recommend it. :)
author: Jocie M.

description:
How is this place so highly rated? I work over in an area of SOMA where lunch choices are scarce. Our boss loves this place and at least once of month the boss will order lunch from here for the entire office b/c it delivers. When the boss says, "let's get Zoah's" a wave of anxiety and fear spreads across the office. 

I'm literally terrified of getting food here b/c it almost doesn't matter what I order, about 90% of the time I end up feeling sick after eating food from here. I've tried ordering food that is seemingly non-sketchy (like the veggie udon or some of the veggie sushi). Each and every time Zoah's never fails to make me feel sick. Now I just order a side of rice each time to play it on the safe side.
author: Athena E.

description:
I've been coming here for 4 years and I still love it. the avocado roll is my all-time favorite, simple but always fresh and bright green. did you know 'Kanikama' means fake crab ? I decided to save 80 cents and tried the avo roll and never went back to Cali.

the staff is always a pleasure, even during the busiest lunch hour. try it once, you'll def be back
author: Prima D.

description:
I'm not saying this place has great sushi.  Cause it doesn't.  And even the teriyaki could use some work.

But lets face it, as far as lunch sushi is concerned, this place is cheap, and a lot better than it should be.  And thats why its packed to the gills at lunch every day.

I wouldn't bring a date.  But if you need fast, cheap, decent sushi, you could do a whole lot worse.
author: Steve S.

description:
I've order the chicken/beef teriyaki before but the meat scares me.  It's the kinda meat that you're not quite sure what it is ... or where it's from.  I'd be interested to see a before and after pic of the food before it's served. I've ordered the white rice (pretty safe) and the gyoza which is fine.  Mostly though, I've stuck to just ordering the shrimp tempura dish, though the veggies and shrimp have been soggy lately and now, I just get gyoza and plain rice.  It's pretty basic and I've never become sick as a result.  One of my coworkers got sick off udon so started getting something else and the food still didn't sit well. 

The thing that really gets me is we of course order for delivery.  But the delivery guy never, ever comes up to our office.  He always calls from his cell phone and says "Yeah, I'm downstair".  Meaning get your ass down here and pick up your food.  It's always irritated me.  I mean delivery means the food comes to you, not you go pick up the food.  Arrgh!!!!  He's definitely not the nicest guy.  Other places totally come up to our office and bring it to us.  He must be just lazy.  I will say the delivery is pretty quick.

I've had better Japanese food at other spots. It's not that cheap either.  The place down the street from my apartment is better, not great but better tasting.
author: imelda j.

description:
I love Zaoh.  I love that they deliver, I love that the bento box is more food than I can eat in one meal, and I love the super sweet staff.  Super Super Sweet.

It's standard sushi but the portions are very generous.  And did I mention the staff are too? Oh yeah, I did :)

This is my go-to "ah I'm starving must eat now" place in the 'hood.
author: nomi c.

description:
I was driving to my friends house on Mission about to turn right onto VanNess and I looked to my left and saw this Japanese restaurant.  Since my friends and I haven't decided on lunch... we decided to go here.  Never can get enough Japanese food!!  

Luckily... even though it was afternoon hours, this restaurant was still OPEN!  Gotta love Japanese restaurants who don't close for those 3 hours!  SCORE!!!!  

The inside looks much nicer than the outside.  Like they said, don't judge a book by it's cover.

We looked at the menu and the prices were GOOD!  I took home a to-go menu.  2 item combos for $9.95.  I love Yellowtail and order the Hamachi Roll (Yellow Tail and Scallion)- 8 pieces for $4.50!  LOVE IT!

The staff was extremely nice and you can tell a lot of regulars come in here because they would greet the regulars by name and ask about them. 

All in all, great restaurant.   They deliver too, so next time I visit my friend... we are ORDERING IN!   $15 minimum won't be a problem!!!  It's SUSHI!!!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Please don't go here for lunch. It's always packed and for those of us who work in the area, we love that we can pop in here and get quick, cheap decent food. If you didn't know, this is one of a handful of restraurants in the neighborhood that cater to the government employees in the area.  These restarants all have similar price points, same rate of service, similar quality of food. 

If you are looking for a new restaurant to try on a lark, pleased go here after 2 p.m. or in the evening or weekend. Thank you.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I love Zaoh! My family and I have been going there for yeeaaars.

The sushi is good but I live for the sesame chicken/teriyaki chicken combo (yeah I'm weird- too many sesame seeds to commit to just sesame chicken) and the cabbage salad with their special dressing (amazing!).

The service is great and they deliver! This place gets packed for lunch-you've been warned.
author: Valerie A.

description: Did they step their game up? I think so. I had been avoiding this place for the longest, thinking that I've been to better Japanese spots. Today, I had a craving specifically for tempura. I went solo for a late lunch, 3pmish, and there were 3 other people there. I was greeted and seated immediately. I was given hot green tea and bean sprouts. I'm not a fan of bean sprouts, so I didn't touch them. I ended up ordering a Combo plate with shrimp tempura and salmon sashimi. The miso soup had other vegetables in it, which I'm not used to, but it was fine. I usually eat the packet type. The salmon was amazing, melted like butter. The tempura was pretty perfect too. There was a mound of rice and a white radish like salad (sorry, I don't know what it's called) that had a mayonnaise-y dressing. I'm completely stuffed and satisfied. Thanks Zaoh...I'll be back :)
author: Mary C.

description:
Very few places will deliver Japanese food, and for this service I am giving it a generous 2 star rating.

That being said, I will have to edit my previous review:

TERRIBLE.  The rolls I had were bland at best and reminded me of chewing on rubber balls more than fresh fish.  Not that I've chewed a lot of rubber balls in my day, but its an experience not easily forgotten.  The sesame chicken is identical to the teriyaki chicken except it has some seeds poured atop.  When my coworker opened the box and saw his chicken bento box lunch, his precise words were:

"Yowser!  By mine own eye I do decry
the quality of this meal.
The fat so oily yet meat bone-dry
mine disgust I shan't conceal.
Fair Mari I blame thee not
for this tragedy is not yours;
this terrible meal we have bought
is covered in nasty spores."

Ok.  So no, he didn't say it quite like that.  It was more like, "Wow, this is some lowwwwwwww quality meat."  And no, there weren't any bacterial spores, either.  Allow me my artistic license, dammit.

Anyway, the lady on the phone barely spoke English and {unsurprisingly} I receive roughly double the nasty things I had ordered.  You know its a bad sign when people won't eat the free food that has just arrived.

OK, OLD REVIEW:
The sushi I've had here wasn't mind-blowing... the rice was a little on the gooey side and the fish wasn't that flavorful.  It was fine, and priced low enough so that I didn't mind.  I've had a few rolls and some side dishes, including a halved avocado filled with spicy chunks of maguro.  Mmmmmm, what a wonderful idea!  The seaweed salad was also quite good and a generous portion.

I would give this place 3 stars based on flavor alone, however the relatively affordable prices and delivery service bump it up a notch.
author: Mari C.

description:
zaoh is stumble distance from the house, so 2 stars just for me being lazy.

Another star for the tempura soba - appropriately salty. All  yummy with the shrimp and veggies and noodles.

A fourth star for a super sweet waitress that says "thankyou thankyou" like from a japanese sitcom.

Five stars for rubbing elbows with Mark Leno while enjoying the sashimi lunch special.

Oh, the sushi? Nothing super, but not horrid either. Decent and tres affordable.
author: RT G.

description:
They just delivered the most magnificent lunch ever -- in the RAIN! :)

Sittin around the office, wishing I had something more tasty than the eggs in the refrigerator, I consulted Yelp and found Zaoh. I am so glad I did.

Lunch was delivered 24 minutes after I called - unbelievable.

Asparagus tempura was still crisp and tender - dipping sauce was light and tasty.

great seaweed salad - wish I knew how to make this stuff.

Avocado stuffed with maguro -- wow. 

Maguro and toro sushi  were top notch.

THat and they delivered a bottle of unfiltered sake  (hey, it's the Wednesday before Thanksgiving... indulgence is in order!)

Satisfying deliciousness delivered right to my door. Yay.
author: SisterMable S.

description: They have the best service, the freshest fist, and the best sides. Everything is flavorful and healthy. I eat here all the time and I always look forward to it.
author: Sarah D.

description: Really?!  Delivery clocked in at 80 minutes when they quoted 30-45.  No excuses for this, no matter how good the food is.  Would NEVER order delivery from here again.
author: Rita L.

description:
not bad for when you're craving Japanese food in the Mission/Civic Center area. its cheap, and a good fix when you're not feeling like eating a sandwich or a hot dog or a taco or something nasty from John's Cafe on Mission Street. 

I always get Tempura Udon and I asked it to be COLD.. served over ice. it's not on the menu, but ask them very nicely and they'll charge you $1 extra. That plus a cabbage salad is good to go for me!
author: Lauren Y.

description: My friend took me here for lunch and I became a fan.  Although it looks sketchy coming here because there's bums you gotta dodge on the way here. I mean, it's not a super clean fancy place, but I come here when I want fast/cheap sushi to go or take a coworker here for lunch.  The service is really fast and the workers here are really nice and sweet. The chicken Katsu is good here, but you can't go wrong with fried food. LOL
author: Joanne D.

description:
Zaoh is pretty much everything it should be.  It's a cheap, fast, friendly lunch spot.  The sushi is fresh and abundant (8 pieces in a roll, free and yummy sprout salad tacked on).  The staff is completely nice.  Its decor is plain and comfortable. It's a good place to eat alone, and it's a good place to eat with other people.  Plus, they have free delivery--can you think of other sushi places that do?

My office is 2 blocks from Zaoh, and, for lunch delivery and meeting food, we have spent approximately one million dollars at Zaoh over the last two years.  I consider the money very well spent.  

Strange to say, but the place Zaoh must reminds me of is Valencia Pizza and Pasta.  Both are plain, unpretentious, friendly, good, and inexpensive.
author: Linda J.

description:
I didn't realize that eating sushi for lunch on a Saturday was a near-impossible feat.  I called around to about half a dozen places before I found one that was open.  Luckily, that one was Zaoh.  Two of us came here and had 2 orders of nigiri (tuna and yellow tail) and 3 rolls (spicy tuna, shrimp & avocado, and their "new wave' roll which is smoked salmon and cream cheese) for under $25.  Totally decent sushi, fresh, well-done, not the best sushi I've ever had but for the price, it definitely hit the spot!

The bonus was the extremely friendly waitress who attended to our every needs quickly, efficiently, and always with a smile.  The decor is nothing exciting, and the location is really odd.  Despite that, I enjoyed our meal and satisfied my sushi-on-Saturday-afternoon craving!  Will definitely be back when another one strikes.
author: I-Chant C.

description: I'm in this neighborhood (Mission/11th-ish) once or twice a month, for meetings  just past the dinner hour.  Zaoh works really well for me to kill time and grab a quick dinner.  The food's simple, good, cheap, and reliable and the folks who work there are unfailingly friendly.  I've never failed to leave with a happy tummy and a warm heart.  Thanks, Zaoh--I'm glad you're there.
author: Earline A.

description: This place is always good and they deliver!!! I'm a huge fan of the Udon on days when you are WFH sick or just home sick period. That and some sushi to pour lots of wasabi on really clears you up when you got a cold Its not the best in town but they deliver and are always timely.
author: Michael K.

description:
I like this place.  I like the people that work there.  I love the way i am treated and the fact that I can always get a seat.  i like that there is rockstar parking everytime.  I like that I see regulars go there.  I go about on the average, 1 X/month.  And i have never been steered wrong.

I don't get sushi here, though i have ordered a huge sushi platter for catering.  I get the other japanese food.  Mostly, I get the sesame chicken plate which i love.  I love the salad that comes along with it and ask for extra, which they never charge me for.  I like the spinach sesame appetizer.  I like the miso soup, I like the genmaicha tea.  

I have nibbled on other's sushi and I agree, it is not fantastic, but why not try their other japanese food and enjoy!
author: Leslie I.

description:
Love this place.
I have lived in the area for 10+ years and I still go.
The same family has been running it.
It's not fancy but the Sushi is great and pretty cheap
author: Gianmaria C.

description:
Sushi delivery...nuff said

however, i will add:
Spicy tuna is actually spicy
hamachi and salmon were fresh
fresh and tasy cucumber salad,
and the price was right
author: Kevin G.

description:
the service here is great.
the people are really really friendly.

the sushi is so so but i feel like there is stiff competition in the city.

i would say the cooked stuff is the way to go.
the sobas are good.
the cooked fish over rice is pretty good as well.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
This place is all right.  They are run by Chinese people and talk in Cantonese while walking around taking orders.  I'm not impressed with this place.  It's normally packed by 12:05 for lunch.  Sushi is all right, teriyaki chicken is all right, service is all right.  I normally have to get it for take out and just eat it back at my office.

needless to say, i've had better
author: Tim L.

description:
Zaoh single handedly changes the way I eat sushi...

Story Time!!

So, I was in a show at Momma Calizo's right down Mission Street and I visited Zaoh for sushi take-out during my rehearsals.  The staff is SUPER nice, and offered me miso and tea every time I came in to place and pick up my orders.  Before Zaoh, I was a very trepidation sushi eater...eating the rolls that had the least amount of fish and was mostly avocado, crab, and sauces..maybe something baked or deep fried...and NEVER anything with roe, eyech!  The first thing I had at Zaoh was the gyoza, because I didn't see anything but traditional sushi on the menu.  The next day I asked for a recommendation, and it was delicious!  The third day, I had a 20 min long conversation about  types of sushi and flavors and textures, and I ended up walking out of there with two bags full of food for my hubby and I!!  The quality and simple decadence of the food, the  service, and knowledge of the staff  still what I compare all my new sushi endeavors to!

Fresh, simple, flavorful, friendly, open late, and delivers!  This place rocked and rolled my world!
author: Jessi K.

description:
This was my go-to japanese place in the city - super quiet, the people are always really friendly, nobody knows about it...

they have great sushi, excellent tempura, totally reasonable prices, and... i don't know what else to say about it. i freaking love this place. i want to be there right now. i'm starving.
author: fiona b.

description:
This place is a solid option for sushi in the area, especially for lunch if you work nearby, or if you want a place that delivers. Their willingness to deliver alone is worth some kudos. 

I work less than a block from this place, and we visit fairly frequently, but that's more because of a lack of other options than because the sushi is so good. 

These guys do a decent job for a reasonable price, but don't come expecting incredible fish. It'll satisfy your craving for sushi, but it's not going to win any awards any time soon.
author: Peter B.

description:
I was brought here on a business lunch.  Ordered the lunch box of white tuna sashimi and vegetable tempura.   Both items were actually quite good.  The white tuna mostly melted in my mouth and was generously portioned at 7 pieces.  One cut was a little tougher than the rest.  Miso had a ton of stuff in it e.g. carrots, etc. 

All in all, not bad...will go back for lunch occasionally
author: Aberdo G.

description: This place is not bad, it is ok for a quick lunch.  The food is Chinese version of Japanese food...meaning that the fish came out of the freezer.  I had the combination sushi lunch plate. It contained four of tiny half-inch width pieces of tuna, cucumber, salmon,  one-inch width pieces of california roll, and two puny futomaki rolls.  The quality was equivalent to the pre-packed super market stuff.  I guess I shouldn't expect much for $8.50.  The miso soup did not taste like miso soup, had an overpowering carrot taste. The so-called miso soup had the same flavor as the soups that generally accompanies the lunch plates at the Chinese restuarants.  The beef teriyaki is ok, tender but servings were small like the sushi plate.  Don't call this a Japanese place, food tasted more Chinese than Japanese.
author: just d.

description: Overheard here from the mouth of a pretentious, art-loving woman: "I love Japanese food, but I can't stand raw fish." When she ordered later, she asked if they have egg rolls. I couldn't stop laughing. It's a Japanese restaurant. Sure, it's Chinese-owned, but it's Japanese food! A and his family have been coming here for years, so they love this place. I'm neither hate nor love sushi, so I find this place all right. Small selection which makes it easier to decide.  Very friendly owners/service who always ask A how his family's doing.  When we come here, it's uncrowded and quiet. Closed on Sundays.
author: Yan E.

description:
Awesome little place. Never really busy so its super quiet. I wouldn't say its the best sushi in the world but its good and fast. Plus the wait staff are nice.

I dig it!!
author: Miles C.

description: I first started ordering Zaoh's take-out and was pleasantly surprised.  Albeit sometimes they have warm sushi rice, the food is solid and tasty and has become a sort of comfort food for me.  Their cabbage salad is amazing.  Prices are excellent with nice serving sizes.  I just went to the actual restaurant for the first time and although the hole on the wall isn't that great on decor, our waitress was very friendly!
author: Kat D.

description:
great service and very, very reasonable prices.

i go here regularly for lunch. i know it looks a little beat from the outside, but the fish is pretty good here and there aren't many other good food options nearby.

while its not exactly a destination restaurant, you can confidently order sashimi here for lunch, which you can't do at the joints over in nearby hayes valley.
author: Essron J.

description: Overated. Prices were okay but the sushi reflected that. My nigiri was nothing special, I had to spit out a fish scale which really put me off. The general atmosphere of the place was not up to my (low) standards for eating raw fish which made it tough to enjoy. My chair had a ball of wasabi on it which I realized after I got up. I love wasabi, but not so much when it's mashed into the ass of my jeans. The pickled bean sprouts they put out as a free app were totally unappetizing. I kept hoping that they would take them away but there they remained throughout the meal. I have a hard time complaining about free tea, but it was luke warm and not very tasty, perhaps just really old. I hate to bash the place, the waiters were friendly, but other than that I really have nothing nice to say. I will not be returning.
author: M L.

description: Almost crack. I judge japanese places by the freshness of their uni and price of it. This one fits both criteria, ive been going here for years and the lady always remembers me and my favorite items. They have a cutty back area that can seat quite a few people. i have never ordered anything and not liked it...i recommend most definitely. try the uni with quail egg.
author: Jean H.

description:
* they deliver *
this is enough to earn them 3 stars from me.  

if the food is - fingers-crossed - as tasty as the other reviewers claim it is, this place could easily net 5 stars.  i'm unwell and craving sushi, though, so i could very well be more generous tonight than i would normally be.

[ update ]
the food was delicious! and not just by delivery-food standards.  the fish was very fresh, the miso soup was actually quite nice (no prepackaged powdered mix rubbish here), and the spicy stuff had sufficient bite.  

good sushi + reasonable prices + delivery = GREAT HAPPINESS
author: Adele T.

description: The sushi was fine (except for the halibut which was extremely stringy and impossible to chew), and the prices reasonable.  However, the restaurant lacked warmth and character, and I did not feel comfortable there (probably says more about me than the restaurant).  I'd probably get take out from Zaoh if my other neighborhood sushi joints are closed, but I doubt I'd dine in again.
author: Grace W.

description:
I went twice. The first time I didn't like it, the second time I got very sick. Can I say for sure that the food made me sick, no. What I can say is the food is not good.

(I didn't have sushi, not quite sure who would eat sushi from here.)

I would rather eat at a random spot chosen by a person on the street than go back here.
author: rachel l.

description: Good lunch spot - seems to be full every day.  3rd star is for value; the sushi is good but unremarkable.
author: James B.

description: Awesome place, I came here from yelp's recommendation for cheap sushi in my neighborhood (muchas gracias, iphone) and me and my friend were not disappointed. we had a red tuna roll, a california roll, a shrimp roll and one of the fancier rolls which I think it was the perfect amount for two. Not to mention 2 big bottles of sake and 3 beers, we were one happy table. In fact, the only table there on a monday night. Great service, good sushi at a great price, I'll  be sure to come back. And they deliver too so that's Good To Know!
author: Rogerio F.

description: Out of the way lunch spot on Mission and Van Ness for Japanese/Sushi.     There is a complete lack of good quick lunch spots in the Civic Center area and this fits the bill. They have good sushi and sashimi lunch specials for under $10.00.
author: Michelle M.

description: The food is incredible, the service is quick and friendly and the staff is down-to-earth.  Zaoh gives good value for quality food.  I can't live without the Chicken Katsu!
author: Tak O.

description:
Yelper's are so right on.  You guys are like my magic eight ball.  Today I rummaged through the take out menu drawer at work and found Zaoh's menu.  I'm a little reluctant about any Japanese delivery since Japanese food tends not to be deliverable.  There aren't many Japanese delivery places and the places who do offer delivery also have Chinese food on the flip side of the menu.  Hmmmm that seems a little suspect.  Anyway back to the magic eight ball.  So as soon as I glanced through the menu taking particular notice of their large selection of vege rolls and before I  decided to blindly call in my order, I checked with my magic eight ball(yelp) and to my surprise I noticed fairly good reviews about this place.  Almost everyone seems to say that Zaoh's sushi is "unremarkable".  Indeed the service is nice and prices are right.  I really don't have to add anything else.  I got the vege roll, futomaki, ume maki, and bean sprout salad and yes they were all unremarkable but good nonetheless.  However the most remarkable thing about Zaoh is the super speedy delivery.  I felt like it took them 30 minutes to make it, box it, and drive it more than 15 blocks during lunch hour!  Yay for Japanese delivery!  Thank you magic yelp ball!

P.S. sorry for the three consecutive exclamation points!!!
author: Joni S.

description: I just went there for lunch for the first time because it's close to where I just started working.  Had the Butterfish steak-- very delicious.  Also free tea and very friendly service.
author: Jesse K.

description: Yeah, not superlative, but good quality, inexpensive, decent portions and they deliver.  Trying to get a seat on a weekday at noon is damned difficult.  Skip the teriyaki.  The super sushi special is a bargain.  Even though I know they're probably using packaged udon for a buck and re-selling it to me for 7x the price, I'll pay for it every time.
author: Esther R.

description: I used to work around the corner from this place.  So, it was really convenient  for me to come over for lunch. I don't think there are any other Japanese restaurants in the area. So, I came here at least once a week. It was always packed but they always had seating either at the bar or in the back area.  They have decent Japanese food at decent prices.  I always used to get the lunch specials and everything I've tried was very tasty.
author: Rowena D.

description: My parents first took me to Zaoh when I was 8.  My then-boyfriend and I ate there before heading to prom.  I now order delivery from them about once a week.  Needless to say, I love this place.  The staff is super-friendly (the same folks all these years--they've seen me grow up!) and the sushi is cheap and SO yummy!  The fish is fresh, you get great cuts (no weird stringy streaks), and the tempura is never soggy.  Grab the super sushi combo if you're going for lunch.
author: Nicci S.

description: deelicious and good prices... very clean and fresh fish, daily.
author: patty r.

description: For what it is - a small, local sushi joint - it's great.  Great prices for lunch and dinner, big portions, and really quite fresh.
author: Frankie D.

description: I checked this place out for lunch once, and I got a stomach ache after eating.  The place is dirty inside, not to mention have "new specials" signs up from 2003.  The staff are unfriendly, and the sushi not of quality one would expect to find anywhere in the bay area.  They own and run the chinese restaurant next door, which is somehow much better and no resulting stomach ache.  Go figure.
author: Lindsey M.

description: Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Not very good sushi. Good in a pinch, I guess.
author: Bob M.

description: This spot is awesome. I stop here for lunch all the time, they have great sushi and yummy udon noodle soup on a cold day. The food is always quick, fresh, and delicious!
author: Megan C.

description: I've been two times. The first was really good and the second was okay. I like their hand rolls. The fish was much better the first time. I guess it's somewhat related to luck.
author: Dennis G.

description: 1 block from work I seem to end up here once a week. Relatively cheap for a sushi joint Zaoh is always packed for lunch. Try their Donbori combo (white tuna + chicken teriyaki) for 9.95. Its a lot more raw fish (for the same price) than their 2 item lunch combo.
author: Jeemster C.

description: I ordered 20 rolls (~160 pieces of sushi) and edemame for a group function, and not only was it under $100 but it was also put in a giant wooden boat for presentation!  The delivery guy was about 15 minutes early and a little late picking up the boat, but the food was great and I will definitely come here again!
author: Stacey H.

description: The food was quite good.  We started with Gyoza and Vegetable Tempura, both met our expectations.  Sushi Roll was fresh and Beef Don was flavorful.  The price was fair too.  Top that off with good service and you've got some happy customers.
author: Dwight B.

description: Super cheap, super fast and the sushi is decent.  The miso soup is tasty.  The chicken teriyaki is alright.  Great place for a fast lunch in this area.
author: Lisa C.

description: Consistently good.  My husband has been going here for more than 20 years that would make it almost 12 years for me.  I always get teriyaki chicken with shrimp tempura. I love their cabbage salad and bean sprout appetizer. The hamachi kama plate is also delicious.
author: Lauren S.

description: I have only been here one time but I can say that I had a great time! I was here for my friend's graduation party and it was lovely! It's a really chill place and the food is awesome! I had some great sushi and at a reasonable price! The staff are friendly and are happy to oblige to any of your requests! Always service with a smile!
author: Mel P.

description:
i only give this place 5 stars because it's the best place for me to get udon during the cold work days. sometimes the service is too slow, and we end up taking more than an hr.

we used to go so often that the staff knew us and didn't give derek miso soup as he never eats it. that's the kind of service i like!
author: Ameer N.

description: YAY!  Finally found a sushi place that delivers good sushi :)  The sushi was fresh and tasty!  Definitely my go to place for delivery sushi.
author: Rosh C.

description: I love this place!! Decent sushi, reasonable price and very nice staff. We've been going here for about 10 yrs. now and it has always been consistant. The avocado salad is a must!!! hmmmmmm
author: Ateh M.

description:
this place is right by my work, and when i'm not at ted's deli, i'm getting a lunch combo here. 

the sushi is alright, not groundbreaking, but tastes good. chicken teriyaki is good, but skin on (if that bothers you)

its always packed for lunch, but they can always make room for you. nice staff, very attentive.
author: shaine h.

description: I really wanted to like Zaoh, I really did.  It's fairly inexpensive, which is a plus.  However, what makes a place a real "find" is that it's inexpensive, *and* delicious.  Zaoh was inexpensive, but not that great.  At least I didn't feel like I got ripped off, which is never too much fun.  I also gave it three stars because of the value.
author: A A.

description:
I have never in my life had such a quick delivery. Ever. It took them under fifteen minutes. I'm in the Mission, so not too far from SOMA, but I remember a pizza place literally around the corner from my house growing up that still took about fifteen-to-twenty. I was, therefore, rather impressed before I started eating.

As for the food: I will admit that I'm no sushi connoisseur, but I liked it quite a bit, and it was very reasonably priced compared to what I've seen of sushi pricing (which, as a non-connoisseur, has usually appalled me). I partook of the New Wave, hamachi, and shiitake rolls, and I enjoyed them all.
author: Tea B.

description:
Zaoh is just a stones throw from my house but i first went there about 15 years ago when i worked at Esprit in Potrero Hill, a bunch of us would get in the car and drive over there for lunch because the lunch special was so good and the prices made it worth going out of our way.  Moshi Moshi was much closer but a little more expensive.
i moved to the neighborhood 10 years ago and for the first few years always went to Sushi Zone but have given up on that place - the food is superb but the waiting is agony, the last time i went there it was a 4 hour tour to get dinner, waiting/sitting on a wooden beam for an hour and a half while 2 people sat drinking beers at one of the 2 tables.... but that's another story.
for the last few years i've been going to We Be Sushi on Valencia for the early bird special, a good deal and decent sushi that fulfills my sushi craving for around $10.  
this Halloween eve. hubby and i were returning from a wedding in east bay and wanted sushi, we didn't want to get anywhere near the Castro and wanted to eat near home.  suddenly i remembered Zaoh, we go straight there and the parking gods gave us a spot right in front.  there was no waiting, the waitress/hostess immediately looked familiar, i think she's been there since i first started going.  it was so nice to get a seat right away.  i think their main business is from the lunch crowd so on a wed eve. around 7:30 there were ample tables available.  the food was much better than i remembered.  the miso soup was very tasty, way better than the average miso which is more salt than flavor, this was flavorful and had nice little crispy tofu pieces and seaweed bits. the seaweed salad was a generous portion for 2 and yummy.  
we got ama ebi and were very happy they serve the heads, it was delicious, the heads were tempura fried to perfection, crunchy and full of flavor.  we had the soft shell crab roll, and the crab was perfect, warm, crispy on the outside, with a melt in your mouth perfect center.  catapillar roll had a lot of nice, fresh avacado that was 'like buttah' but next time i'll pay 1/2 the price and get rock n' roll.  saba nigiri was fresh and tasty.  maguro nigiri was fine yet 'unremarkable'.  hamachi was fresh and delicous.  hubby gives a demerit point for the rice which is not bad but could use improvement.
for dessert we had the mango mochi balls, they taste like the ones we buy at Trader Joes but who cares? they're yummy and the perfect ending to a very good meal.
the tab was astoundingly reasonable for a feast of sushi, sake, and dessert.  the service was friendly, attentive and fast - a breath of fresh air in the City.  
i have lived nearby this place for 10 years now and this is only the second time i've dined here in as many years, not sure why, the last time i had the unagi donburi which was delicious.  Zaoh is back in my restaurant rotation 'greatest hits' from now on.  and reading reviews here i find out they deliver, good to know.
i give it 5 stars for what it is, reasonably priced fresh and good food. i've been to many Japanese restaurants in the City, you can pay about the same or a whole lot more and get lesser quality.
author: aLiSoN m.

description: My favorite place for a quick sushi/lunch fix. Their chirashi always seem to hit it for me. Fresh fish, hot tea, good quick service - almost too quick as I sometimes feel rushed on their rush hour. But no matter, they will always be my closeted pleasure.
author: Dyin P.

description: Very charming hole in the wall atmosphere and easy to get a table on a week night. Good quality for low price = great value. The hostess is incredibly friendly and always remembers my order (I think she even recognizes my voice on the phone when I order take out, which is only once every two weeks).  When you don't want to wait at Sushi Groove or Blow Fish (or overpay), check this place out!
author: Words O.

description: Had not been to this restaurant for a long time. (Moved out of the city 18 years ago) Now that I am back, I decided to try some of the old eating  establishments that I used to frequent.  I was in the area by Zaoh and decided to drop in for lunch with my friend.  I found the food to be fresh and reasonably priced. I know that it is disconcerting to hear Cantonese in a Japanese restaurant, I found that to be the fabric of the restaurant scene in this city-Chinese cooking Italian or Hof Brau style foods, Mexicans cooking Chinese food, etc. The fact of the matter was the food was good at Zaoh.
author: Henry H.

description: Grew up around the corner from Zaoh and have gone there for years.  The waitress and cook are the same people that were there 12 years ago and they are very friendly.  Must admit I have had better sushi but the restaurant has improved over the years.  The food is not bad for the price.  I enjoy the friendly atmophere, fast service and comfort food.  Might not be for everyone but it is a nice place for regulars.
author: Christian S.

description:
I used to eat here regularly two years ago before I moved. I visited yesterday while I'm in town and discovered how horrible the service  and how salty the food has become. 

The server didn't even ask if we wanted a drink. Had to ask for a spoon because they just handed the miso soup and left. Very inattentive waitstaff. 

They only paid attention when I was about to leave and sign the bill.

Crappy service. Bad food. Will not visit again.

I miss the place it was two years ago, with great food and service.
author: poing p.

description: I've been eating at this place for over 10 years and it's a great lunch spot.  However, I recently discovered that they overcharge on delivery orders so just be careful if you are getting food delivered.  One a $50 party tray of rolls, we were overcharged $4.  At first, I thought I miscalculated but my coworker mentioned that she ordered a couple of lunch combos and felt she was overcharged $1 and change.  Recently, we ordered a lunch combo and some rolls. I asked the lady on the phone to calculate the total for me.  She did and I mentioned that she may have miscalculated.  She stuttered and said to let her calculate again.  She said something about how she may have miscalculated the tax and then agreed with my calculation. Like I said, it's a great lunch spot, but just be wary of what you're charged. Some favorites are Sushi & Sashimi combo, chicken teriyaki and sashimi combo, bean sprout salad and the mango roll.  Enjoy!
author: Julie W.

description: I always order combination at this place.  It's a great place for lunch around this area.  Any two combination is only $10 and their food is not bad.  It's a small place and it might be a bit crowed if you have a large party during lunch.  Serving is just right to fill your stomach.  Love this place and will go again.
author: YELP U.

description: This is a great neigborhood sushi restaurant.  The food is good, the quality is reliable, and the service is always friendly.  I particularly love their hamachi rolls!
author: Andrew S.

description: It's easy and convenient - I work right around the corner so it's perfect for me.  Prices are reasonable, although I did spend $18 including tip today, which made me cry a little and I could have eaten another roll.  But that's what you get for eating sushi for lunch I suppose.  The waitresses are very nice, and everything goes really fast.  I usually sit at the bar and eat by myself and the one annoying thing is that almost ALWAYS the other people sitting around me at the bar are talking obnoxiously loud on their cell phone.  C'mon people - this is the one hour of my day where I get to be AWAY from the office and the last thing I want is to sit by 5 other people who are chattering away on their cell.  It is very rude to other customers and to the sushi chefs and waitresses.  Overall, nothing fantastic, but easy and quick.
author: Jessica S.

description: Good Teriyaki.  The portions are huge and it is inexpensive.  The service is always very nice.  I just wish they would remodel a bit.  The place has been there a while, and I think just updating a bit, would make it seem cleaner.
author: ChaCha C.
